Title: Senior Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

As a PowerBI consultant, you will help our clients solve complex BI issues. You collect data from different sources,build sustainble datamodels, optimize datasets for reporting and develop user-friendly PowerBI dashboards. Based on your own expertise and the Sopra Steria BI methodology, you increase the quality of reporting and visualization at our customers. In addition, your input will contribute to the vision and development of our Data Visualization team.

Understanding data is important. With the Sopra Steria solution for Data visualization, we help organizations do just that. We do this by visualizing information and data. We make abstract information accessible and understandable. Based on the right insights, we can then make data driven decisions about next actions Microsoft technologies such as PowerBI, Fabric, Azure, ... hold no secrets for us.

Within our Data Visualization team we want to help each other and keep learning from each other. We do this by working closely together within the team. So are you looking for new challenges with great colleagues and a steep learning curve? Then the Data Visualization team at Sorpa Steria is the right place for you.

Qualifications

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You‚Äôll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have at least 3 year of experience with data visualization and can demonstrate this with a demo or portfolio
You have at least 3 year demonstrable experience with PowerBI
You have experience with performance tuning of PowerBI solutions
You dare to be creative, but do not lose sight of the details
Knowledge of best practices and visual design principles
You act as an expert and coach people
You communicate fluently, both with your colleagues and the customer
A good knowledge of data modeling and dimensional modeling concepts..
Knowledge of HTML/CSS and programming languages such as javascript, python, C# is also a plus
Data visualization is your passion
Adding your dashboards or portfolio in the application is a plus
Knowledge of exernal tools like Tabular editor are a plus
You are proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe‚Äôs largest digital solutions providers, you‚Äôll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you‚Äôll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You‚Äôll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you‚Äôll join our Data & AI team, where we‚ÄØsupport enterprises‚ÄØand institutions to become more data driven, and assist our‚ÄØclients to increase business efficiency‚ÄØand create‚ÄØimpact with‚ÄØdata. We offer‚ÄØa complete‚ÄØportfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden‚ÄØorganisations in every step‚ÄØof their‚ÄØtransition: from defining‚ÄØand executing‚ÄØthe data strategy‚ÄØand governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards‚ÄØand applying‚ÄØthe latest‚ÄØdata science and artificial‚ÄØintelligence methodologies. ‚ÄØ

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Senior Data Analyst Consultant
Description:
Tasks

Lead and deliver complex client assignments, ensuring quality assurance and guiding consultants in their daily tasks
Assist clients in addressing their most pressing data and regulatory challenges, including credit, risk, finance, client, and ESG regulations
Analyze data to derive valuable insights and take ownership of implementing solutions while measuring their effectiveness in partnership with the client
Build and nurture strong client relationships, including training junior consultants and engaging with senior client management
Facilitate post-delivery meetings to assess project value and performance, ensuring continual client satisfaction
Lead proposal processes end-to-end and ensure successful project completion
Support Senior Managers and contribute to the development of practice value propositions and directors during key meetings




Benefits

Dynamic and challenging environment to start your career in Financial Services
Opportunity to work on a wide range of complex and rewarding projects for prestigious clients within the banking industry
We promote internal knowledge sharing, a dedicated Risk and Regulatory Academy, external courses and professional certification programs (e.g., FRM, PRM)
We invest in the development and progression of our people to maximise their potential
We are a non-hierarchical organisation and promote openness, teamwork and knowledge sharing within the firm and the Reply Group
We offer a competitive base salary alongside a benefits package including bonuses to reward performance




Qualifications‚Äã

At least 3 years of professional experience working as a Data Analyst
Masters Degree or equivalent in Finance, Economics, Business Management, Business Engineering or other relevant field of studies
Fluent in English as well as able to speak either Dutch or French
You have advanced proficiency in SQL and/or Python
You possess solid expertise in data manipulation, analysis, cleansing, extraction, transformation, loading, and visualization techniques
You have experience working with data tools such as Collibra, Mega Hopex, MicroStrategy, Dataiku, Qlik, Power BI, and Tableau
You have an interest in AI and a strong understanding of data-related concepts such as data quality, metadata, and Master Data Management







About Avantage Reply

Avantage Reply, part of the Reply Group, specialises in Financial Services consulting with a focus on Governance, Risk and Finance Transformation, Treasury and Capital, Quantitative Modelling, Compliance and Regulatory Advisory. With offices across Europe, we count some of the world‚Äôs most significant financial groups among our clients, including in Investment, Retail and Commercial Banking, Custodian Banking, Insurance and Investment Management.

Title: China Analyst
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

25-May-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

6,467.30

Grade

NATO Grade G15


SUMMARY



NATO‚Äôs Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO‚Äôs public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO‚Äôs work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Analysis Team develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA China Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. Working in the IEA analysis team, the China Analyst provides dedicated analysis and reporting to a range of audiences within NATO, in particular to the NATO Assistant Secretary General of Public Diplomacy. The incumbent therefore monitors, analyses and assesses China‚Äôs activities in the information environment, including in priority regions such as the Indo-Pacific to contribute to NATO‚Äôs situational awareness, help guide NATO‚Äôs engagements with partners in the region and strengthening NATO‚Äôs ability to respond to information threats.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE



Essential

The incumbent must:


possess a university degree, from an institute of a recognized standing, in a field relevant for the role;
have two years of analytical experience, including in qualitative and quantitative research methods;
possess proven experience in developing reporting products for senior and/or executive audiences;
possess strong writing and oral presentation skills ;
possess at least upper-intermediate level knowledge in Mandarin, with an emphasis on reading and listening skills;
possess geopolitical knowledge of China;
possess proven research and analytical skills;
demonstrate proficiency in utilising standard computer applications to support analytical efforts and product development;
have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within a multicultural team and with diverse stakeholders across the Organization;
possess the following minimum levels of NATO‚Äôs official languages (English/French): V (‚ÄúAdvanced‚Äù) in one; I (‚ÄúBeginner‚Äù) in the other.



DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:


familiarity with current web-based and other tools to gather topic-related information;
understanding of current international events and their impact on NATO‚Äôs work;
experience with the intelligence cycle including: requirements, collection, processing, analysis, dissemination and feedback;
experience in developing quantitative metrics and analysis trends;
knowledge of and/or experience in analyzing state-sponsored information threats, using all-source information to characterize hostile information actors‚Äô campaigns, capabilities, and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs).
experience in measuring and assessing the effectiveness of communications;
knowledge of evaluation and assessment methods and techniques to assess communications activities, including relevant measurement and assessment frameworks and tools.
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES



Information Management

Contribute in an active, timely and well-coordinated manner to PDD‚Äôs work in the area of Information Environment Assessment, by delivering high quality reports including actionable recommendations based on the assessment of the information environment. Glean and share insights with PDD leadership on information threats targeting NATO.

Knowledge Management

Keep abreast of industry developments relevant to Information Environment Assessment, including emerging best practice analytical methodologies. Provide clear insight and recommendations to civilian and military staffs from multiple disciplines, including those directly responsible for analysing and evaluating information and communications products. Ensure that this expertise is translated into effective Information Environment Assessments reporting. Use sound political judgement when making recommendations on adjusting NATO‚Äôs communications based on regular analysis and assessment.

Expertise Development

Research and follow all types of platforms to ensure that analysis products include relevant sources from the information environment, including from the media. Contribute to the ongoing improvement of analysis products, including by benchmarking against other international organisations. Keep up to speed on the latest analytical and assessment tools. Test information environment assessment, media and information threats analysis tools. Contribute to developing data literacy across the Public Diplomacy Division and the NATO Enterprise. Integrate meaningful data insights into information environment assessment and media analysis.

Stakeholder Management

Work closely with the IEA Data team, Audience Research team and StratCom policy team within the section to integrate IEA into the communications planning process and coordinate seamlessly with other sections within PDD. Develop and maintain professional relationships across the civilian and military staff to promote synergies within and between different disciplines, including intelligence, cyber, operations, data policy, logistics, and information management. Work with Allies and partners, including the European External Acton Service and G7 Rapid Response Mechanism, to exchange expertise related to analysing information threats. Coordinate effectively with various stakeholders in order to get useful inputs with actionable recommendations for the delivery of regular IEA reports. Identify, strengthen and build relationships with partners, researchers and other experts to become better informed on IEA.

Project Management

Plan and deliver reports within tight deadlines on issues of relevance to PDD and senior NATO leadership. Demonstrate political acumen when selecting topics and analysing and assessing trends in the information environment. Work with other divisions at NATO to deliver briefings for senior NATO staff. Use initiative to recommend opportunities for Information Environment Assessment.

Perform any other related duty as assigned.


INTERRELATIONSHIPS



The incumbent carries out their duties under the overall direction of the Head, Information Environment Assessment Unit, and following day-to-day guidance of the IEA Analysis Team Leader. They maintain a close working relationship with other staff in the Unit, members of PDD, as well as counterparts in other Divisions, other NATO entities and in Allied Delegations and capitals.

Direct reports: N/a

Indirect reports: N/a.


COMPETENCIES



The incumbent must demonstrate:


Achievement: Works to meet standards.
Analytical Thinking: Sees multiple relationships.
Clarity and Accuracy: Checks own work.
Conceptual Thinking: Applies learned concepts.
Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems.
Empathy: Is open to others‚Äô perspectives.
Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade.
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation.
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others.



6. CONTRACT

Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years; possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO‚Äôs member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel R√©gulations.

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate‚Äôs medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO‚Äôs sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

NATO‚Äôs Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO‚Äôs public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO‚Äôs work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Analysis Team develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA China Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. Working in the IEA analysis team, the China Analyst provides dedicated analysis and reporting to a range of audiences within NATO, in particular to the NATO Assistant Secretary General of Public Diplomacy. The incumbent therefore monitors, analyses and assesses China‚Äôs activities in the information environment, including in priority regions such as the Indo-Pacific to contribute to NATO‚Äôs situational awareness, help guide NATO‚Äôs engagements with partners in the region and strengthening NATO‚Äôs ability to respond to information threats.

Title: Data Analyst - NL
Description:
Je probeert graag businessvragen rond klanten op te lossen aan de hand van
analytische methoden? Je werkt graag in een dynamische omgeving in volle
evolutie? Je neemt graag initiatief en wil bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling van
een multidisciplinair team binnen de afdeling Client Data & Analytics?


Dan ben jij onze nieuwe Data Analyst !

Je taken


> Descriptieve interne en externe gegevensanalyse

- Je
staat in voor interne analyses die betrekking hebben op de
distributiekanalen en op het gedrag en de verwachtingen van de huidige en
toekomstige klanten. Je voert die analyses uit aan de hand van passende
analytische methoden (profiling, segmentering ...) om de juiste
doelgroepen en kanalen voor marketingcampagnes te helpen bepalen.

-Je
voert ad-hocanalyses uit ter ondersteuning van het management.


- In
samenwerking met de collega‚Äôs voer je grondige strategische analyses uit
die betrekking hebben op het gedrag, de behoeften, het potentieel en de
waarde van de klanten.


> Rapportering en voorstelling van de conclusies die

- Je
staat in voor het noteren en samenvatten van de conclusies van de analyses
in dashboards (klanten en distributie).

stelt de conclusies van de analyses voor aan de betrokken
collega's/managers.
- Je
analyseert de klanten-KPI's om een stand van zaken op te maken met
betrekking tot het jaarplan.


> Contactpersoon voor interne analyses

- Je
bent de contactpersoon, volgt je analyses op en beantwoordt vragen over de
verrichte analyses. Op die manier geef je je kennis door en zorg je ervoor
dat de informatie op de juiste manier begrepen en gebruikt wordt binnen de
organisatie.
- Je
deelt je kennis over klanten/distributie met andere betrokken interne
partijen om de klantervaring, de relaties en de communicatie tussen
P&V en haar (potenti√´le) klanten te verbeteren.

- Je
hebt een diploma met specialisering in een kwantitatieve of zakelijke
discipline, of gelijkwaardige ervaring.

hebt minimum 3 jaar werkervaring in een functie van Data Analyst.

met minstens √©√©n BI- of analytische tool (SAS, R, Python ...) is een must.

hebt een zeer goede kennis van het Nederlands en/of Frans, en een goed

Desguinlei 92, 2018 Antwerpen
Koningsstraat 151, 1210 Brussel
- Extralegale voordelen- De P&V Groep biedt heel wat extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, ecocheques, een bedrijfsrestaurant, een cafetariaplan, flexibele werktijden en telewerkmogelijkheden, maar ook personeelskortingen bij verschillende partners (en een auto voor bepaalde functies).

Waarom werken voor de P&V Groep?
- De P&V Groep is een co√∂peratieve verzekeringsmaatschappij die verzekeringen toegankelijk wil maken voor zoveel mogelijk mensen. Daarnaast leveren we een actieve bijdrage aan een meer solidaire samenleving via onze ecologische en maatschappelijke projecten. Onze Stichting P&V ondersteunt actief burgerschap en komt op tegen de sociale uitsluiting van jongeren.
- Wij zijn een Belgische groep , dat betekent dat alle beslissingen in Belgi√´ worden genomen.
- De P&V Groep stelt de mens centraal , zowel medewerkers als klanten. We willen een groep zijn met een menselijke waarde en tegelijkertijd een prominente plaats in de Belgische verzekeringsmarkt behouden.

De P&V Groep ondersteunt een beleid van diversiteit en inclusie in de rekrutering van haar medewerkers. We zijn vooral op zoek naar talent, ongeacht gender, leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond of geloofsovertuiging. Als co√∂peratie is solidariteit een van de pijlers van de P&V Groep. Title: ESG Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Position description

Business unit

Investment Management - ESG Investments & Research

Job title

ESG Quantitative Analyst

Contract type

Permanent

Candriam Group Presentation

Candriam is a global multi-specialist asset manager and a recognized pioneer and leader in sustainable investment. For more than 25 years, Candriam has offered innovative and diversified investment solutions across many asset classes including fixed income, equities, absolute return, asset allocation and illiquid assets.

As a Responsible Employer, Equal Employment Opportunity is crucial to Candriam. We are committed to building the best global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We provide an inclusive work environment and support wellbeing and work-life balance.

Mission

Within Candriam, the ESG Quantitative Analytics and Research team is a Front Office team that copes with various transversal projects linked to ESG. Its main objective is to provide innovative, state-of-the-art ESG analysis frameworks and market leading ESG investment solutions.

We are hiring an ESG Quantitative Analyst who will support and enhance the ESG universe that incorporates all the internal ESG analysis. This person will act as the liaison between Investment Engineering team, ESG analysts and Investment Managers.

Responsabilities

Based in Brussels, he/she will contribute to the following missions:


ESG universe production, support and enhancements:



Produce the internal ESG scorings/ratings and eligibilities for portfolios.

Performs controls on ESG universe updates and coordination within the whole ESG team.

Analyze variations in the eligibility decisions of issuers and provide clear explanations.

Enhance of the ESG universe and participate in the new target architecture around ESG data.

Link with Managers, IT and ESG referential data team.


Enhance internal ESG models to be more in line with evolving client‚Äôs demand and regulations:



Develop ESG algorithm solution in Python.

Improve models and documentation linked to controversial activities

Simulate and implement new models linked to clients demands, regulations and labels.


Build tools for the team and other departments:



In particular specific tools via Power BI.

Profile

Master's degree in fields such as Quantitative Finance, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Environmental Science or Engineering.

Minimum 2 years' experience in similar role, within the Financial Services sector.

Strong interest in ESG.

Skills :

Good communication skills.

Strong IT knowledge, programming skills and working knowledge in Python are required.

Solid understanding of financial maths and instruments.

Proficient in PowerBI and Excel

Azure synapse and Factset are a plus.

Experience with ESG data providers

Pro-active and stress resistant

Analytical, synthetical mind and strong eye for details

Team player.

Ability to explain analysis and/or models to non-technical audience.

English fluent. French or Dutch would be a plus.

Job location


Candidate criteria

Education


Master's Degree I / Bac+4



Minimum Level Of Experience Required

2-5 years

Languages

English (C1 - Fluent)

Title: Advanced Analytics Lead
Description:
Make your mark for patients




We are looking for an Advanced Analytics Lead who is a strong leader and business translator to join our Global Advanced Analytics Team. This position will be based in our headquarters in Anderlecht, Brussels, Belgium. This hybrid position requires a minimum of 40% on site presence.




About The Role

You will deliver data-driven actionable insights from advanced analytics that create high impact patient value within the patient solutions and patient evidence domain. You are a leader with deep advanced analytics skills in leveraging patient real-world data.




Who You‚Äôll Work With

As a key member of the Global Advanced Analytics Team, you will work closely with Integrated Insights Leads and stakeholders across Patient Solutions, Patient Evidence, and Real World Evidence.




What You‚Äôll Do

This role provides leadership in advanced analytics, guiding the identification of high-impact business questions and opportunities to improve patient outcomes at UCB. You‚Äôll make exceptional business impact through advanced analytics methods, enabling increased use of data, and reducing the necessity for primary data. Your expertise will drive objective, evidence-based decision-making and ensure the successful delivery of advanced analytics solutions.




You will:

Be a strategic partner to internal stakeholders (e.g., Integrated Insight Leads, Patient Solutions, Patient Evidence, Real World Evidence, etc.) to co-create analytics plans and priorities, ensuring collaboration with IT, Data Office, and other analytics teams.
Lead end-to-end advanced analytics projects, delivering actionable insights and clear recommendations through effective communication, visualization & story-telling to non-technical audiences.
Mentor and guide junior data scientists and translators in applying cutting-edge analytics, communicating insights, and implementing recommendations.
Foster a strong data science community with significant business acumen and communication skills.




Interested? For this role we‚Äôre looking for the following education, experience and skills

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative area, Master/Doctor‚Äôs in a quantitative area is preferred
Minimum of 10 years of experience working with patient real-world data (insurance claims, EHR, lab test results, HCP notes, registries, etc.) is required
Minimum of 10 years of experience developing program/project plans and leading programs/projects from initiation to implementation is required
Minimum of 10 years experience applying predictive modelling techniques such as ML, decision trees, ensemble learning, neural networks etc, and data engineering such as data integration, feature engineering, fuzzy matching, etc., is required




Are you ready to ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don‚Äôt just complete tasks, we create value. We aren‚Äôt afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that‚Äôs on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions will be made without regard to any characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

UCB invites you to voluntarily self-identify during the application process. Provision of self-identification information is entirely voluntary and a decision to provide or not provide such information will not have any effect on your application for employment, your employment with UCB, or otherwise subject you to any adverse treatment. Any information you provide will be considered confidential and will be kept separate from your application and/or personnel file and will only be used in accordance with applicable laws, orders, and regulations.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on US-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com for application to US based roles. Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Position Title: Data Engineer

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Duration: 7 Months

Languages: Dutch, French and English

Work mode: Hybrid




Job Description:

We are looking for a driven and detail-oriented Data Engineer with a passion for designing, developing and maintaining robust ETL processes and data warehouses. Has extensive experience with SQL databases and preferably NoSQL databases, and a proven track record in optimizing data infrastructures to support decision-making processes.




Core Competencies:

ETL Development and Management: Expertise in building and maintaining advanced ETL processes to efficiently extract, transform, and load data from various sources.
Data warehousing: In-depth knowledge of data warehousing concepts and techniques, with experience in designing scalable and reliable data storage solutions. Knowledge of dbt.
Database Management (SQL & NoSQL): Proficiency in working with both relational (SQL) and non-relational (NoSQL) databases, including but not limited to MySQL, PostgreSQL, Neo4j, Elastic DB, MongoDB, Milvus.
API Integration: Experience in developing and integrating APIs.
Data Modeling: Experience in designing and implementing data models that improve performance and simplify complex queries.
Data Quality and Integrity: Strong focus on ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data.
Programming skills: Mastery of programming languages such as Python for process automation and data analysis.
Problem-Solving Ability: Excellent analytical skills to solve complex technical challenges and deliver data-driven solutions.




Education:

‚Ä¢ Minimum of a bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Data Science/Business Informatics or equivalent.

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in the field of data engineering, data warehousing and database management.




Technical skills:

Databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, Neo4j, Elastic DB, MongoDB, Milvus
ETL tools: dbt
Data: Python, SQL
API development: REST, SOAP, GraphQL
Cloud platforms: Azure, AWS
BI tools: Power BI




Skills

AWS
Azure
dbt (Data Build Tool)
MySQL, PostgreSQL, Neo4j, Elastic DB, MongoDB, Milvus
POWER BI
Python
REST - SOAP
SQL

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone‚Äôs effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.




Fincons is looking for a Data Scientist




with strong hands-on experience in Microsoft Azure ecosystem, particularly with Azure Fabric, Power BI, and AI/ML integration to support the enhancement of existing systems and APIs through intelligent solutions.




Technical Skills




üîπ Cloud and Platform Expertise

Extensive hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure, including:
Azure Machine Learning
Azure Data Factory
Azure Synapse Analytics
Azure Data Lake Storage
Azure Databricks (nice to have)
Practical knowledge of Microsoft Fabric for data engineering and analytics scenarios.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps, including pipelines and automated deployment.




üîπ Data Science & AI

Solid practical experience in machine learning model development and deployment, including:
Supervised and unsupervised learning
Feature engineering and model evaluation
Experience with model integration into production systems/APIs
Strong Python programming skills, including:
Use of libraries like pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, TensorFlow or PyTorch (at least one)
Understanding of MLOps principles and lifecycle in Azure ML.




üîπ Data Integration & Engineering

Ability to connect and transform data from multiple sources using Azure services and APIs.
Experience working with structured and semi-structured data (SQL, JSON, XML).
Familiarity with data pipeline orchestration, performance tuning, and error handling.




üîπ Power BI & Visualization

Proficiency in Power BI, including:
Building dynamic dashboards
DAX expressions
DirectQuery vs Import models
Gateway setup and refresh optimization
Ability to translate analytical insights into business-friendly visualizations.




Additional Skills (Nice to Have)

Experience with OpenAI/ChatGPT or Azure OpenAI Services.
Knowledge of API architecture, RESTful APIs, and integrating AI models into API workflows.
Exposure to CI/CD pipelines and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
Microsoft certifications (e.g., Azure Data Scientist Associate, Power BI Data Analyst Associate).




Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving mindset and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently and within cross-functional Agile teams.
Clear communicator, capable of explaining complex models to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to performance, scalability, and maintainability of AI-enhanced systems.




English (C!) required




Office: Brussels

modality of work: near-site




If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Title: AI engineer Consultant
Description:
The team, position & mission:




Are you passionate about data? Do you like creating a real impact by tackling some real-world problems our clients face by developing algorithms for recommendation engines, developing natural language processing algorithms or employing deep learning methods on information? If you answered yes, this could be the job for you! As an AI engineer, your job will be to propose and develop advanced analytical models for a series of different clients and in different industries like life science, media, public, banking, insurance and others.




Your key areas of responsibility as AI engineer Consultant:




Proposing and developing advanced analytical models for a series of different clients and in different industries like life science, media, public, banking, insurance and others.
Working as a consultant for big clients, accompanied by your colleague experts in the field. An analytical career path will help you to develop your skills and obtain your objectives on the long term.




As an ideal candidate you have:




A master‚Äôs degree or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Engineering, Physics or any related field
2-5 years relevant experience in data science / data analysis / data mining
Passionate about data and/or statistical analysis, with mathematics and modelling skills
Experience in at least one of the following sectors: Banking, Finance, Risk, Marketing, Customer Intelligence, Life Sciences
Experience with SQL
Some experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, ...) is a plus
Experience with applying regression, classification, natural language processing, clustering/ segmentation, time-series forecasting, anomaly detection or predictive maintenance is a must
Proficiency in data sourcing (web-scraping, API, etc.), data transformation and data preparation techniques
Excellent programming knowledge in Python and/or R
Good coding practices and code refactoring experience is an advantage
Interest in machine learning, deep learning and/or MLOps
Experience using Cloud Data Platforms (Azure, GCP, ...) for Data Science projects is a plus
Ability to understand the business requirements and develop new/existing algorithms to satisfy those requirements
Strong communication and presentation skills
Being able to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience and explainable AI is an advantage
Conceptual and creative thinking
A plus: Hands on experience in Enterprise Intelligence (e.g., Data Warehousing, Data Management, Business Intelligence, Analytics, Big Data ecosystem)
Fluent in English and French and/or Dutch
Experience in using tools leveraging Generative AI and/or developing yourself projects that make use of Generative AI is a plus




What we offer you:




Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
We may work with tomorrow‚Äôs technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
Read more about the benefits we offer here




About Orange Business:

Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.




Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.




With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.

  • 2-5 years relevant experience in data science / data analysis / data mining
  • Passionate about data and/or statistical analysis, with mathematics and modelling skills
  • Experience in at least one of the following sectors: Banking, Finance, Risk, Marketing, Customer Intelligence, Life Sciences
  • Experience with SQL
  • Some experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, ...) is a plus
  • Experience with applying regression, classification, natural language processing, clustering/ segmentation, time-series forecasting, anomaly detection or predictive maintenance is a must
  • Proficiency in data sourcing (web-scraping, API, etc.), data transformation and data preparation techniques
  • Excellent programming knowledge in Python and/or R
  • Good coding practices and code refactoring experience is an advantage
  • Interest in machine learning, deep learning and/or MLOps
  • Experience using Cloud Data Platforms (Azure, GCP, ...) for Data Science projects is a plus
  • Ability to understand the business requirements and develop new/existing algorithms to satisfy those requirements
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Being able to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience and explainable AI is an advantage
  • Conceptual and creative thinking
  • A plus: Hands on experience in Enterprise Intelligence (e.g., Data Warehousing, Data Management, Business Intelligence, Analytics, Big Data ecosystem)
  • Fluent in English and French and/or Dutch
  • Experience in using tools leveraging Generative AI and/or developing yourself projects that make use of Generative AI is a plus


What we offer you:


  • Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
  • We may work with tomorrow‚Äôs technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
  • An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
  • A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
  • Read more about the benefits we offer here


About Orange Business:

Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.


Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.


With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.

Title: Forecast Analyst BeNeLux
Description:
Job Description

You are a brand lover. You want to be in the driving seat and to make impact. You want to work with a multi-cultural team where diversity is valued for what it brings ‚Äì divergence of opinions that makes our life and business richer. You want to create amazing coffee moments for consumers through brands like Douwe Egberts, Jacqmotte, L‚ÄôOr or Senseo. Then this job is for you.

We‚Äôre looking for a Forecast Analyst BeNelux to be part of our Demand Planning team BeNeLux, which includes Supply Chain Planners, Copack Planner and IBP Leads. You're be based in Brussels or Utrecht, with occasionally traveling to Utrecht/Brussels and will report directly to the Demand Planning Manager.

Key Responsibilities


Create weekly forecasts for BeNeLux cross-sell, wholesale, and Direct-to-Consumer (DtC) channels, aiming for highly accurate sales projections per week/month/customer.
Ensure optimal stock positions and service levels through precise forecasting.
Analyse internal and external data to generate accurate sales and marketing projections.
Anticipate external factors in a dynamic market environment.
Actively participate in project teams for successful new product launches.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders like Supply Chain, Sales, Shopper Marketing, Marketing, and Procurement.
Support the development and implementation of standardized ways of working and drive continuous improvement initiatives


Your Focus as Forecast Analyst


Maintain a helicopter view of the business while updating forecasts and closely tracking market changes.
Evaluate sales data and external sources at customer/segment level.
Lead the sales prep meetings and category activation discussions.
Take part in (international) forecasting-related projects, working on SKU optimization and complexity reduction.


Qualifications

Working for the world's largest pure-play coffee and tea company comes with big ambitions ‚Äîand with those ambitions, comes big responsibility. Working at JDE Peet‚Äôs is hands-on, giving you an opportunity to leave your mark.

For this role we are looking for someone who has the following skills and experience:


2‚Äì5 years of experience in Supply Chain or Sales (e.g., Demand, Inventory, or Supply Planning)
A strong personality with drive, leadership qualities, and initiative
Proactive approach in suggesting improvements and process optimizations
Strong analytical skills and ability to identify data trends
Project management experience and ability to lead projects independently
You are fluent in English. Dutch and French are a plus
This role is open to candidates based in Belgium (office in Brussels) or Netherlands (office in Utrecht)


Additional Information

What‚Äôs it like to work at JDE Peet‚Äôs?

We are people united by the power and possibility of tea and coffee. At JDE Peet‚Äôs, we thrive on the freedom to pursue opportunities, provoking new ideas to make an impact at scale. Our ambition is simple ‚Äì JDE Peet's: unleashing the possibilities of coffee and tea.

At JDE Peet's, we believe it‚Äôs amazing what can happen over a cup of coffee or tea. We also believe that a diverse and inclusive culture enables us to serve every coffee and tea lover in the best possible way. No matter who you are, where you come from, how you live your life, you can fulfil your ambitions and contribute to our success. When you grow, we grow, and coffee & tea grows.

At JDE we offer a competitive compensation & benefits package, for this role this includes a flex income plan, 33 days of holidays, a bonus opportunity, eco and meal vouchers, etc‚Ä¶ We value meeting colleagues in the office (Esplanade 1, 1020 Brussels: only 10 minutes‚Äô walk from Metro Heysel) and we enjoy our focus time when working from home: we support you in getting the right ergonomic material to work from home efficiently and even offer the option to take a ‚Äòworkation‚Äô!

What‚Äôs next?

Interested? We‚Äôd love to hear from you! After we received your application we will do our utmost to give you quick feedback. Part of the recruitment procedure will be an online assessment, followed by interviews and a business case.

Our DE&I Statement

At JDE Peet‚Äôs we aim to create a better future where we authentically serve, reflect and embrace everyone. We believe in fostering a more diverse, equitable and inclusive organisation where everyone feels comfortable to truly be who they are and unleash their full potential. This means we do not tolerate discrimination on the basis of our race, ethnicity, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, age, disability, or any other trait protected by law. Do not hesitate to reach out if you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process.

Find out more at https://careers.jacobsdouweegberts.com/

#unleashyourpossibility #acupofamazing

Title: Data Engineer (H/F)
Description:
As a consultant within our agile team, you‚Äôll leverage your expertise to provide strategic guidance, working closely with customers and internal experts to drive lasting improvements and operational excellence.




Your work will focus on the following areas :

Design and build data pipelines to collect, process, and store large datasets.

Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing validation and cleaning processes.

Optimize data storage solutions for efficient querying and analysis (e.g., databases, data lakes).

Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver actionable solutions.

Implement data integration strategies to connect disparate data sources and provide unified data access.

Monitor and maintain data infrastructure to ensure performance, scalability, and reliability

Advise on best practices for data governance, security, and compliance.

Participation in the development of internal solutions




Who are you?

You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer !

You are fully proficient with one of the following languages: Python, Java, JavaScript

You are familiar with Big Data tools such as Databricks, Spark, Scala, Kafka, Flink

You have experience working with at least one major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP) and with the different Database types

You have a good knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases such as GCP BigQuery,‚Äô PostgreSQL, Cassandra, MongoDB

You should be proficient in modern DevOps technologies. Specifically, you should have hands-on experience with at least one key tool-such as Kubernetes, Terraform, or Helm

Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Junior System Engineer
Description:
Are you looking for a meaningful experience in a high-tech company with a human-centric approach? At TMC, we allow you to build your career with our employeneurship model. Join us now!




We are seeking a Junior System Engineer to support our IT infrastructure and ensure the smooth operation of our systems. The ideal candidate will have a basic understanding of networking principles and a keen interest in developing their skills in system engineering.




Your key Responsibilities will include




Assist in the installation, configuration, and maintenance of IT systems and networks.
Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure optimal operation.
Support the implementation of network security measures and protocols.
Collaborate with senior engineers to develop and maintain system documentation.
Provide technical support to end-users and resolve hardware and software issues.
Participate in the planning and execution of IT projects and upgrades.
Stay current with emerging technologies and industry best practices.




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Basic knowledge of networking concepts and protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP).
Familiarity with operating systems (e.g., Windows, Linux) and system administration tasks.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Fluent in Dutch and English; good knowledge of French is a plus.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Eagerness to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CompTIA Network+, CCNA) are a plus




What can you expect from us




TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to its clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC operates as an expert center at the disposition of its clients, and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster-changing technological world.

At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.

As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

Title: Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position


Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools


Qualifications

What we are looking for


3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
Fluency in English mandatory
German is a plus


Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you‚Äôll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You‚Äôll Love


Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
Hybrid work set-up
40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-ap√©ros, and regular company-wide events
Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
Gender-neutral fair-pay
18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)


Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people‚Äôs lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobili√®re and General Atlantic.

Disclaimer

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The L‚ÄôOCCITANE Group is a leading international manufacturer and retailer of premium and sustainable beauty and wellness products. The Group operates in 90 countries worldwide and has 3,000 retail outlets, including over 1,300 of its own stores. Within its portfolio of premium beauty brands that champion organic and natural ingredients are: L‚ÄôOCCITANE en Provence, Melvita, Erborian, L‚ÄôOCCITANE au Br√©sil, LimeLife by Alcone, ELEMIS, Sol de Janeiro and Dr. Vranjes Firenze.

With its nature-positive vision and entrepreneurial ethos, L‚ÄôOCCITANE Group is committed to investing in communities, biodiversity, reducing waste and to finding sustainable solutions to create a better and healthier planet. The mission statement of the Group is: With empowerment we positively impact people and regenerate nature.

L‚ÄôOCCITANE is also committed to sustainability for business, people & the planet, as well as respect of human rights, ethics principles and labour protection. All employees at L‚ÄôOCCITANE must therefore implement the company‚Äôs mission and integrate the social, environmental, economic and legal effects of their actions in their day-to-day job. In practice, this means that any employee at L‚ÄôOCCITANE shall contribute to growing sales, regenerating nature, caring for our consumers & partners and supporting our employees. The L'OCCITANE Group is a certified B CorporationTM.

Context

L‚ÄôOccitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).

Main Responsibilities


Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L‚ÄôOccitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins
Support the deployment of Power BI solution


How You Can Fit


Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is preferred
Proficiency in Excel and Power BI
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline


STARTING DATE: July 2025 for 6 months (full-time position)

LOCATION: Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

L'OCCITANE is an equal opportunities employer. This means that, when making decisions about our employees' careers with us, our main considerations are their ability to do their jobs and develop in their roles. One way we cultivate change is by creating a more diverse and inclusive workplace and organizational culture. As part of this, we are committed to building an environment that is free from discrimination and harassment where everyone feels respected and valued. We recruit positive-minded people who share our core values - entrepreneurship, team spirit, leading by example and authenticity - and our commitment to sustainability.

Title: Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you‚Äôve got big plans ‚Äì so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people‚Äôs lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: July 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role


Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.


Your Profil


Currently pursuing a master‚Äôs degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous


What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe that this variety drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of a team that is dedicated to Sparking Discovery and Elevating Humanity!

Title: Logistics Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

Title: Data Analyst Intern

Description du poste :



CONTEXT:

L‚ÄôOccitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).

Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins

Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt

LOCATION:¬†Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

Title: Junior Power Analyst
Description:
Junior Power Analyst




Due to our continuing expansion, an exciting position has opened up in our Power Trading Team for a Junior Power Analyst. This role will offer the opportunity to work, learn, and grow alongside experienced professional traders and analysts, directly contributing to the Team‚Äôs success on the markets.




The successful candidate will work on developing European Power Markets models, simulating supply and demand scenarios and contributing to trading strategies. A strong business acumen is required, as is a passion for quantitative development, given the necessity for continuous interaction with Traders, Meteorologists, Analysts and IT developers.







Requirements:




Ideally you will have 1/2 years of experience in an analytical environment with a degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Quantitative Economics/Finance with solid academic training. Strong data analysis and coding skills (Python, SQL) are a must. You will be fluent in English and a second European language will be considered a plus. Although not absolutely necessary, experience in the power market analysis or energy fields would be advantageous.




Offer:




DXT offers a full-time permanent position with a competitive remuneration package. Help with relocation, if necessary, is also provided. On the job training will be given by seasoned professionals directly on the trading desk. The successful candidate will also receive DXT‚Äôs benefits and well-being package and will be supported by the Duferco Academy for growth and development.







Please send your updated CV together with a cover letter to: hr.power.analyst@dxt.com

Title: Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst

Our company in Schachen employs a diverse group of highly skilled scientists, engineers, technicians, and process specialists from more than 15 nations and provides an important contribution to our company‚Äôs endeavor to bring new innovative medicines to patients as fast as possible, while applying highest quality standards to all activities.

Are you a highly talented biotechnology graduate seeking for a first or new challenge where you are free to take initiative? Would you like to experience working in one of the biggest multinationals in the pharmaceutical industry? We are looking for a graduate student in the field of Biotechnology/Bioinformatics, Data Science or a related discipline, who is searching for a challenging early career position in our innovative company. This role is part of our Future Career Graduate Program which consists in 1 year project-based contract.

Graduate Project

The Schachen Biotech Process Automation team is providing a strategic link between our early and late-stage pipeline and responsible to develop and maintain a ‚ÄòLine of Sight‚Äô between the stages.

The Data Analyst Graduate Project will consist in creating an innovative solution for finding and visualizing correlations between multiple sets and levels of real production process and analytical data. Implementation of PowerBI dashboards for visualization of real time data, focused on representing the key process parameters, key metrics and visualization of out-of-range values for the batches or campaigns. As an extended implementation, creating PowerBI Dashboards to represent a contextualized real time data from SAP (Bill Of Materials, Bill Of Parameters, Inventory) and MES data (Parameter Value Lists) for an overview and possible de-bottlenecking of the Batch/Campaign running.

This will also include working with intelligent automation solutions using AWS and Azure cloud capabilities and tooling, implementation of Power BI dashboards representing the process data and as well possibility of implementation of machine learning algorithms as well as Python or R programming.

As a graduate you should bring energy, knowledge, innovation to carry out the following


Collaborating with various business teams in an international setting to generate business understanding and identifying relevant data sources.
Assess the process and analytical data, collect, clean, and interpret the data available.
Prepare data for analysis and representation in PowerBI Dashboards.
Providing a fresh perspective within the department your opinion matters.
Participate and actively learn about Digital Transformation initiatives involving system integrations, data connectivity and value-based optimization of manufacturing via process supporting analyzation.


The above-mentioned responsibilities are an indication of what you will be doing after proper onboarding and initial learning and development. This provides you with the opportunity to learn and hereafter perform tasks independently. In consultation with your supervisor or peers, you could take on additional tasks and responsibilities.

What Skills You Will Need

In order to excel in this role, you will more than likely have


A graduate student in Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Data Science.
Passionate about Process Data Science and Data Analysis.
Proven experience in bioprocess engineering, analytical methods, and process data interpretation.
Basic knowledge in Python and/or R.
Basic knowledge in Power BI, Databricks, or Dataiku is preferred but not required.
You are searching for a program where you have the freedom to take initiative.
Effective oral / written communication skills in English.


What We Offer

Being an intern at our company means you will work together with a team on healthcare in an international environment. As a student, you will get the opportunity to develop yourself. In addition, we offer


The possibility to gain experience within the pharmaceutical industry.
The chance to show your potential.
A challenging and dynamic work environment with lots of space to develop yourself.
Professional guidance by an experienced specialist.


What We Look For

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another‚Äôs thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace

Current Employees apply HERE

Current Contingent Workers apply HERE

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme LLC, Rahway, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.
