Title: Data Analyst Intern at Operations Performance Management & Development (limited 3-12 months, 40-100%, all genders)
Description:
Operations Performance Management & Development is right at the heart of SWISS‚Äô operations, contributing every day to insights-based decision making and continuous performance improvements of our airline operations. This is a unique opportunity to gain experience not only data analysis, but also airline operations.

Starting date: July 01, 2025, or upon agreement.

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating an impact with tangible business improvements? Then join our SWISS Operations Performance Management & Development team and apply your data skills to actual business challenges shaping SWISS‚Äô journey towards a truly data-driven company!

As a Data Analyst Intern you take a front-seat role in advising SWISS‚Äô operations management. You will support running data projects, ad-hoc analysis, and have the chance to get a glimpse of how we use and enhance the operational data landscape of a global airline.


Provide valuable data-driven insights supporting decision-making within SWISS‚Äô Operations & Steering team
Create data visualizations, reporting, and interactive dashboards
Create insightful analysis to help quantifying key drivers to optimize SWISS‚Äô operational performance
Contribute to our operational data landscape & support automation
Foster data democratization and self-service capabilities across the company
Collaborate and effectively communicate data insights across various stakeholders from SWISS Operations departments


Benefits


Flight benefits
Employee and networking events
Remote working (e.g. from home)
Discounts
25 days of annual vacation
Diversity programmes
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Subsidized parking or public transport
Company health management


Requirements


Workload Specification: For this position, a 100% workload is preferred
Data science and/or data engineering background is an advantage
HF diploma, Bachelor‚Äôs, Master‚Äôs students or graduates (HF diploma & Bachelor‚Äôs students must have completed at least three semesters) in an analytical subject, e.g., data science, engineering, economics, statistics, mathematics or related fields
Knowledge in SQL coding, good command of at least one programming language (R or Python preferred)
Ability to work independently, yet a team-player with strong communication, and social skills
Excellent oral and written presentation skills; competences in analysis and management presentations
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially PowerPoint, and Excel
Fluent knowledge of English is required; knowledge of German will be an additional asset


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Marius Gisler

recruiting.services@swiss.com

Title: Client Consulting Analyst, Visa Consulting and Analytics
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



What it's all about ...



Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) is the consulting arm of Visa, and drives tangible, impactful results for clients. Drawing on our expertise in consulting, data analytics, digital marketing and economics, VCA solves the most strategic problems for our clients.







Specific Responsibilities include:



Support a team of experienced professionals in delivering strategic consulting services to key Visa clients.



Complete detailed analysis on client data and identify preliminary trends and themes in the data with some guidance.



Conduct market research and data analysis to identify insights in the payment industry.



Support the development of client-specific presentations by adapting templates for unique client scenarios and needs.



Support senior consultants in developing and delivering high-quality advisory solutions to clients, such as business strategy, product development & pricing, customer segmentation and customer experience improvement.



This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 3 set days a week (Tuesday - Thursday), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.‚ÄØ









Qualifications



What we'd like from you ...



Payment industry, digital payments or payment processing experience preferred.



Strategic and analytical thinking with a strong attention to detail that leverages multiple sources of information.



Able to understand and start to disaggregate problem statement into distinct pieces of analysis.



Use and adapt templates for unique client scenarios, optimizing structure to demonstrate + articulate key messages.



Ability to execute quantitative & qualitative analysis with some guidance.



Basic takeaways from the data + starting to craft storyline; ensure data quality + leverage data to support decision-making in project management.



Strong team player with a willingness to collaborate across levels and functional experts.



Strong multi-tasking skills and ability to adapt.



Proficient and ideally a power-user of spreadsheet and presentation tools.



An interest in learning advanced analytics tools (SAS, R, Tableau, etc.).



An interest in payments, financial institutions or consumer lending a plus.



An affinity for payments technology, FinTech and digital.



‚Ä¢ Fluent English and German, both written and spoken (C2 level minimum)





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist
Description:
Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist

Location: Basel (Hybrid working)

Length of Contract: 7 months




Haybury have partnered with a leading global pharmaceutical organization within Switzerland who are seeking a talented Content Insight and Taxonomy Specialist to generate actionable insights to marketing campaigns alongside providing accurate dashboards and reports for business decision making.




This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual familiar with using systems such as Veeva supporting the analytics and growth frameworks for the digital content, ensuring accuracy and integrity is maintained on each activity.




Responsibilities:




Drive the development and rollout of dashboards that measure content performance across multiple brands and markets
Build and maintain scalable content tagging frameworks aligned to business needs
Lead taxonomy design and expansion to support new channels and campaigns
Support onboarding of global stakeholders as new brands/countries join the program
Collaborate with cross functional data teams and platform teams (e.g., Veeva Vault) to ensure data and system readiness
Facilitate continuous feedback loops to extract insights and guide strategic improvements
Contribute to training programs and documentation to support consistent adoption across teams







Qualifications:




Experience in content strategy, insights, or digital marketing analytics
Strong understanding of tagging, metadata, and taxonomy best practices
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Familiarity with enterprise content platforms (e.g., Veeva Vault) is a plus
Excellent collaboration skills across business and technical teams







Reach out to Rory.pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential discussion an further insight to the position.

Title: Data Analyst Consultant
Description:
Organization


M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res


Posted 12 May 2025 Closing date 27 May 2025

MSF Sweden Innovation Unit: Data Analyst Consultant

Contract period: 3 months.

Expected time allocation: 50 - 75% (75-110H/month)

Expected start: June 2025

Background

M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res (MSF) is an international, independent, medical humanitarian organisation that delivers emergency aid to people affected by armed conflict, epidemics, natural disasters, and exclusion from healthcare. These programmes are run through five operational centres. Sweden Innovation Unit (SIU), MSF Sweden support our operations through innovation and research projects with the aim to improve our health programming.

In 2024 SIU launched a digital therapeutics mobile phone app (DTx), tested with an initial pilot cohort of 15 patients. Based on promising results from the initial pilot the DTx app will further scale up across two MSF clinics in Lebanon in Q2 2025, followed by further roll-out in additional project contexts from late 2025. As was done during the pilot, the metadata generated during usage of the DTx app is intended to continue to inform strategic decisions on the app‚Äôs development and usage by the SIU team in addition to being used in upcoming operational research on the Lebanon implementation.

STATA was used for the initial analysis of the meta- data, specifically looking at patterns in app usage. However, this approach is likely not fit for purpose as the user numbers and metadata points expand. Therefore, the SIU is seeking a data analyst to support the exploration, definition and development of a new, scalable approach to manage and analyse data generated by the DTx app, to analyse app adoption, user engagement, operational efficiency, and functional performance, and more.

Specifics on the first metadata analysis

The app metadata were examined in-depth to generate metrics of user engagement with the app, both overall and focusing on selected key features. Selected metrics aimed to quantify patterns of user interactions and preferences, examine app functionality, identify any potential areas requiring improvement, and gain an overall insight of the app‚Äôs relevance and value to users. Broadly, the metrics included elements of: number of interactions; number of conversions (interactions that resulted in a discrete measure of change e.g. saving blood glucose levels; setting a goal; or completing a learning module); frequency and duration of sessions overall and stratified by key features; interactions with notifications and nudges; and patterns of interactions suggesting issues with app design.

Analyses included data from the 15 participants included in the pilot phase. The main metadata consisted of timestamped and itemized interactions of each participant with the app, marking their journey of use across all sessions until 1st October 2024 ‚Äì separated by the key section of the app. These were collated into a single dataset to create a consolidated view of all of each participant‚Äôs interactions with the app. This dataset was then used to summarize the metrics of interest. For individual metrics, such as duration of sessions, we calculated each metric per person and then calculated the average value across participants. Average values reported were either the crude median (interquartile range), crude mean (standard deviation), or mean adjusted for time (95% confidence intervals [95% CI]). Summary categorical metrics such as (such as setting of at least one goal on the app) were calculated as proportions (%) out of the total sample (N=15). In additional exploratory analyses, we stratified certain metrics by available participant metrics to examine potential explanatory factors for the patterns of interactions and engagement observed for the different app features. To enable this, a dataset containing basic participant sociodemographic characteristics (include age, type of diabetes, and other relevant characteristics such as access to a glucometer or continuous glucose monitoring) was merged with the app metadata. Key metrics were then compared between relevant participant groups. Statistical tests were used to assess significance in differences between participant groups. These included Student‚Äôs T test or Wilcoxon rank sum tests for continuous metrics, and Fisher‚Äôs exact tests for categorical metrics. Any comparisons between subgroups were examined using Student‚Äôs T test or Wilcoxon rank sum test (continuous variables), or Fisher‚Äôs exact tests.

Finally, the participant-level data and metadata described above were supplemented with supplementary measures as extracted from the app development platform, including indices such as app crashes and server uptime.

The Assessment of current need

Required

As alluded to above the next phase of this project is projected to require a data analyst with the ability to build on what has been done so far and reconceptualise what is required from a metadata management and analysis perspective going forward in addition to leading ongoing analysis based on raw metadata exports. The team is seeking an individual with experience and expertise in the following areas:

Handling Mobile Health Application Data


Experience working with large volumes of data. DTx data anticipated to reach 500+ users by end of 2025 and 1000s thereafter with some potential increase in required variables captured.
Demonstrated ability to scale data systems over time with changing demands.


Tools and Technologies


Proficiency in SQL and other relevant tools used for data cleaning and analysis.
Experience building and maintaining data pipelines including periodic updates.
Experience developing dynamic dashboards to visualize and communicate key insights derived from data.


Reporting & Automation


Ability to automate reporting processes.
Experience generating reports in formats usable by both clinicians and patients, including automated notifications based on data analysis.


Data Analysis Scope


Skilled in analysing both raw health data and metadata related to app engagement from multiple sources (e.g. logins, feature usage, crash reports, demographic data).
Ability to design and track user engagement metrics for mobile health platforms.


Data Management and Integrity


Experience with data storage, version control, and security protocols.
Ability to troubleshoot data issues, including logging and resolving cleaning problems and developing or contributing to systems that flag data anomalies or quality issues.


Profile Of Consultant(s)

Essential skills:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (Data Science, Statistics, Information Systems, Public Health with a quantitative focus or Health Informatics)
Proficiency in SQL for querying, data extraction, and transformation
Advanced data analysis skills in Python or R (or similar), including use of libraries for statistical analysis and data visualization
Experience managing and analysing large, complex datasets, such as app user metadata
Understanding of health data sensitivity and ethical data handling, including compliance with data protection policies
Proven skills and experience in supporting remotely located teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
A good understanding and knowledge of medical issues and challenges in humanitarian contexts.
Experience working in public health, NGOs and/or the social sector.
Fluent in English written and spoken.


Desirable Skills


Familiarity with mobile app telemetry data, including events, interactions, crashes, and session metrics
Experience working with digital health / mHealth or public health projects, ideally in humanitarian or LMIC contexts
MSF (or equivalent) experience.
Knowledge and working proficiency of Microsoft 365 environment including Teams, SharePoint and Power BI.


How to apply

To Be Submitted


Your CV and motivation letter
Examples of previous work ‚Äì provide a summary of similar work that you have developed and delivered before.
Fee (hourly rate). Include NGO discount if applicable.


Deadline: Midnight 27th May 2025

To submit your application or if you have any questions email natalie.oconnell@stockholm.msf.org

Posted 12 May 2025 Closing date 27 May 2025

MSF Sweden Innovation Unit: Data Analyst Consultant

Contract period: 3 months.

Expected time allocation: 50 - 75% (75-110H/month)

Expected start: June 2025

Background

M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res (MSF) is an international, independent, medical humanitarian organisation that delivers emergency aid to people affected by armed conflict, epidemics, natural disasters, and exclusion from healthcare. These programmes are run through five operational centres. Sweden Innovation Unit (SIU), MSF Sweden support our operations through innovation and research projects with the aim to improve our health programming.

In 2024 SIU launched a digital therapeutics mobile phone app (DTx), tested with an initial pilot cohort of 15 patients. Based on promising results from the initial pilot the DTx app will further scale up across two MSF clinics in Lebanon in Q2 2025, followed by further roll-out in additional project contexts from late 2025. As was done during the pilot, the metadata generated during usage of the DTx app is intended to continue to inform strategic decisions on the app‚Äôs development and usage by the SIU team in addition to being used in upcoming operational research on the Lebanon implementation.

STATA was used for the initial analysis of the meta- data, specifically looking at patterns in app usage. However, this approach is likely not fit for purpose as the user numbers and metadata points expand. Therefore, the SIU is seeking a data analyst to support the exploration, definition and development of a new, scalable approach to manage and analyse data generated by the DTx app, to analyse app adoption, user engagement, operational efficiency, and functional performance, and more.

Specifics on the first metadata analysis

The app metadata were examined in-depth to generate metrics of user engagement with the app, both overall and focusing on selected key features. Selected metrics aimed to quantify patterns of user interactions and preferences, examine app functionality, identify any potential areas requiring improvement, and gain an overall insight of the app‚Äôs relevance and value to users. Broadly, the metrics included elements of: number of interactions; number of conversions (interactions that resulted in a discrete measure of change e.g. saving blood glucose levels; setting a goal; or completing a learning module); frequency and duration of sessions overall and stratified by key features; interactions with notifications and nudges; and patterns of interactions suggesting issues with app design.

Analyses included data from the 15 participants included in the pilot phase. The main metadata consisted of timestamped and itemized interactions of each participant with the app, marking their journey of use across all sessions until 1st October 2024 ‚Äì separated by the key section of the app. These were collated into a single dataset to create a consolidated view of all of each participant‚Äôs interactions with the app. This dataset was then used to summarize the metrics of interest. For individual metrics, such as duration of sessions, we calculated each metric per person and then calculated the average value across participants. Average values reported were either the crude median (interquartile range), crude mean (standard deviation), or mean adjusted for time (95% confidence intervals [95% CI]). Summary categorical metrics such as (such as setting of at least one goal on the app) were calculated as proportions (%) out of the total sample (N=15). In additional exploratory analyses, we stratified certain metrics by available participant metrics to examine potential explanatory factors for the patterns of interactions and engagement observed for the different app features. To enable this, a dataset containing basic participant sociodemographic characteristics (include age, type of diabetes, and other relevant characteristics such as access to a glucometer or continuous glucose monitoring) was merged with the app metadata. Key metrics were then compared between relevant participant groups. Statistical tests were used to assess significance in differences between participant groups. These included Student‚Äôs T test or Wilcoxon rank sum tests for continuous metrics, and Fisher‚Äôs exact tests for categorical metrics. Any comparisons between subgroups were examined using Student‚Äôs T test or Wilcoxon rank sum test (continuous variables), or Fisher‚Äôs exact tests.

Finally, the participant-level data and metadata described above were supplemented with supplementary measures as extracted from the app development platform, including indices such as app crashes and server uptime.

The Assessment of current need

Required

As alluded to above the next phase of this project is projected to require a data analyst with the ability to build on what has been done so far and reconceptualise what is required from a metadata management and analysis perspective going forward in addition to leading ongoing analysis based on raw metadata exports. The team is seeking an individual with experience and expertise in the following areas:

Handling Mobile Health Application Data

  • Experience working with large volumes of data. DTx data anticipated to reach 500+ users by end of 2025 and 1000s thereafter with some potential increase in required variables captured.
  • Demonstrated ability to scale data systems over time with changing demands.

Tools and Technologies

  • Proficiency in SQL and other relevant tools used for data cleaning and analysis.
  • Experience building and maintaining data pipelines including periodic updates.
  • Experience developing dynamic dashboards to visualize and communicate key insights derived from data.

Reporting & Automation

  • Ability to automate reporting processes.
  • Experience generating reports in formats usable by both clinicians and patients, including automated notifications based on data analysis.

Data Analysis Scope

  • Skilled in analysing both raw health data and metadata related to app engagement from multiple sources (e.g. logins, feature usage, crash reports, demographic data).
  • Ability to design and track user engagement metrics for mobile health platforms.

Data Management and Integrity

  • Experience with data storage, version control, and security protocols.
  • Ability to troubleshoot data issues, including logging and resolving cleaning problems and developing or contributing to systems that flag data anomalies or quality issues.

Profile Of Consultant(s)

Essential skills:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (Data Science, Statistics, Information Systems, Public Health with a quantitative focus or Health Informatics)
  • Proficiency in SQL for querying, data extraction, and transformation
  • Advanced data analysis skills in Python or R (or similar), including use of libraries for statistical analysis and data visualization
  • Experience managing and analysing large, complex datasets, such as app user metadata
  • Understanding of health data sensitivity and ethical data handling, including compliance with data protection policies
  • Proven skills and experience in supporting remotely located teams
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • A good understanding and knowledge of medical issues and challenges in humanitarian contexts.
  • Experience working in public health, NGOs and/or the social sector.
  • Fluent in English written and spoken.

Desirable Skills

  • Familiarity with mobile app telemetry data, including events, interactions, crashes, and session metrics
  • Experience working with digital health / mHealth or public health projects, ideally in humanitarian or LMIC contexts
  • MSF (or equivalent) experience.
  • Knowledge and working proficiency of Microsoft 365 environment including Teams, SharePoint and Power BI.

How to apply

  • Your CV and motivation letter
  • Examples of previous work ‚Äì provide a summary of similar work that you have developed and delivered before.

Description:
Description de l'entreprise

Le pr√©sent et le futur d‚ÄôAudemars Piguet se construisent gr√¢ce √† la contribution de tous nos talents. Vous cr√©ez et mettez √† jour la documentation technique, incluant guides d'utilisation et sch√©mas techniques, pour faciliter la compr√©hension et la maintenance des solutions

In einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld erwartet dich nicht nur eine spannende Marke, sondern auch ein modernes Office direkt beim Bahnhof Baar ZG, ein motiviertes Team mit Drive ‚Äì und die M√∂glichkeit, dein analytisches Talent auf ein neues Level zu bringen.




Deine Herausforderung

Als Data- & Insights-Analyst bist du Teil des Category Management Teams und unterst√ºtzt zus√§tzlich das Field Sales Team. Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin mittels Datenanalysen & -visualisierungen Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten. Diese bist du auch in der Lage zu pr√§sentieren und es macht dir Freude, diese mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu diskutieren!




Du analysierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (NielsenIQ Paneldaten, interne BI Daten wie z.B. Aussendienst Performance oder auch Daten aus Marktforschungsstudien) und leitest daraus strategisch relevante Erkenntnisse ab
Du unterst√ºtzt das Category Management mit Visualisierungen, Dashboards (z. B. in Power BI) und Modellen zur datenbasierten Sortiments-, Platzierungs- und Promotionsoptimierung
Du bist Sparringpartner f√ºr das Aussendienst-Team und erm√∂glichst durch smarte Analysen effizientere Verkaufsprozesse und wirkungsvollere Massnahmen im Feld
Du analysierst Marktforschungsstudien zu Konsumverhalten und Shopper Insights und bringst die Resultate in Kundenworkshops √ºberzeugend auf den Punkt
Mit deinem technologischen Know-how in Python, R, SQL und Snowflake entwickelst du automatisierte Reports, aussagekr√§ftige Visualisierungen und smarte Entscheidungshilfen
Du wirkst aktiv mit in internen und externen Meetings ‚Äì und bringst dein Wissen in internationale Austauschformate mit anderen Red Bull Insights Experts ein




Deine Qualit√§ten und Begabungen

Hochschulabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL/VWL, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Feld ‚Äì erg√§nzt durch Know-how in Statistik oder Data Engineering
Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrung mit Data Analytics im FMCG-, Retail-, Konsumg√ºter-, Versicherungs- oder Gastronomieumfeld gesammelt oder bist motiviert dich ¬´on the job¬ª einzuarbeiten
Du kennst dich mit Tools wie Python, R, Power BI, SQL und Snowflake aus ‚Äì und hast Spass daran, komplexe Inhalte klar und verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten
Du bist analytisch stark, hast ein gutes Gesp√ºr f√ºr wirtschaftliche Zusammenh√§nge und kannst deine Erkenntnisse √ºberzeugend pr√§sentieren
Deine Muttersprache ist Deutsch und du verf√ºgst √ºber sehr gute Englischkenntnisse ‚Äì Franz√∂sisch ist ein sch√∂nes Extra
Dich zeichnet eine proaktive und selbstst√§ndige Arbeitsweise aus, du bringst Drive und Motivation f√ºr eigene L√∂sungswege mit




Du m√∂chtest einen echten Mehrwert bei einer internationalen Unternehmung mit lokalem Spirit schaffen? Dich zeichnet ein analytisches Vorgehen mit Blick f√ºrs grosse Ganze aus?




Dann freut sich Stefan Fritschi auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen! Ein Motivationsschreiben, warum dich diese Position und Unternehmen anspricht, kann den Unterschied machen!

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Intern
Description:
Contexte et environnement

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore. TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

The Trading division in Geneva is responsible for optimising the purchase & sales portfolios of gas, electricity, CO2 emissions, dry bulk, and LNG in all recognised markets worldwide, in compliance with the Company trading guidelines.

In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Context & Environment

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Activit√©s

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst is responsible for data retrieval within their portfolio, coordinating with IT and the T/DSOs. This role includes controlling and analysing the retrieved volumes, addressing any disputes, and updating the deals in the ETRM. The team supports business development across additional markets and less-carbonized commodities.

The team acts as the direct liaison to market system operators, ensuring continuous data collection from various sources. They are responsible for comparing volumes, performing controls and analysis, and cleaning the data. This enables seamless and flexible access to accurate and robust data, which is then shared with both internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team collaborates with relevant departments to ensure the accuracy of volumetric data when implementing it into the trading system and reviews the robustness of all internal systems related to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Intern will work closely with the Energy Data Portfolio analysts on the French renewables scope.

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner in the EDM system and communicating to TSO/DSO to retrieve missing volumes
Analysing and controlling volumetric data daily to identify anomalies and inconsistencies before updating the ETRM.
Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, dashboards, reports and alerts on volumetric data to improve the data quality.
Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of the assets.
In coordination with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, request Guarantees of Origins issuance to EEX every month.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.



Profil du candidat

Your profile:


Educational standard required: Engineering or Finance background preferred.
Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools ‚Äì Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have ‚Äì French, Spanish and Italian.



Informations suppl√©mentaires

Show more
HTML:
Contexte et environnement

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore. TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

 TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

The Trading division in Geneva is responsible for optimising the purchase & sales portfolios of gas, electricity, CO2 emissions, dry bulk, and LNG in all recognised markets worldwide, in compliance with the Company trading guidelines.

In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Context & Environment

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Activit√©s

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst is responsible for data retrieval within their portfolio, coordinating with IT and the T/DSOs. This role includes controlling and analysing the retrieved volumes, addressing any disputes, and updating the deals in the ETRM. The team supports business development across additional markets and less-carbonized commodities.

The team acts as the direct liaison to market system operators, ensuring continuous data collection from various sources. They are responsible for comparing volumes, performing controls and analysis, and cleaning the data. This enables seamless and flexible access to accurate and robust data, which is then shared with both internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team collaborates with relevant departments to ensure the accuracy of volumetric data when implementing it into the trading system and reviews the robustness of all internal systems related to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Intern will work closely with the Energy Data Portfolio analysts on the French renewables scope.

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:

  • Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner in the EDM system and communicating to TSO/DSO to retrieve missing volumes
  • Analysing and controlling volumetric data daily to identify anomalies and inconsistencies before updating the ETRM.
  • Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, dashboards, reports and alerts on volumetric data to improve the data quality.
  • Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of the assets.
  • In coordination with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, request Guarantees of Origins issuance to EEX every month.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.


Profil du candidat

Your profile:

  • Educational standard required: Engineering or Finance background preferred.
  • Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools ‚Äì Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have ‚Äì French, Spanish and Italian.

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst
Description:
CLEEVEN, a technology consulting firm, was built on two strong convictions:

The excellence of European engineers must ensure global competitiveness

Our human mission: to support our employees in their personal development.




As part of a strategic project with one of our Swiss clients in the pharmaceutical sector, we are recruiting a Data Scientist / Data Analyst (M/F) with a background in life sciences (pharmacy, biology, medical devices...) to support the teams in the collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data related to the development of new components and medical devices.




Role and responsibilities:

Work closely with R&D, clinical, and quality teams to structure and analyze data from preclinical and clinical studies
Analyze health-related data (efficacy, tolerance, side effects‚Ä¶) to support medical and regulatory decision-making
Design statistical or machine learning models to extract insights from domain-specific data
Ensure data quality: cleaning, structuring, and documentation of datasets
Build dashboards and reports to communicate results to non-technical stakeholders
Contribute to the preparation of technical documentation for regulatory submissions




Expected skills:

Excellent command of data analysis tools: Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn...), R, or SAS
Strong understanding of regulated environments (GxP, pharmacovigilance, medical devices...)
Experience working with biomedical or clinical databases
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, matplotlib, etc.)
Ability to translate complex analytical results into actionable insights for medical or regulatory teams
Experience in pharma, biotech, or medtech environments is a strong plus




Profile:

Engineering degree, Master‚Äôs or PhD in pharmacy, biostatistics, data science, or related field
Prior experience in data science or analytics applied to healthcare
Strong analytical skills, scientific rigor, and autonomy
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work cross-functionally (medical, data, IT teams)
Fluent in English, German and French are a big plus
Valid administrative situation to work in Switzerland




See you soon,

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data ‚Äì how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don‚Äôt hold yourself back ‚Äì apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (‚ÄúDTTL‚Äù)

Beteiligung am Unternehmensgewinn, an den √ñV-Reisekosten, √úbernahme des Handy-Abos, die Nutzung vom Carsharing zu vorteilhaften PreisenBeitrag zu einer nachhaltigen und sinnstiftenden Gesch√§ftsvision leisten und eigene Ideen aktiv einbringen5 Wochen Ferien, bis zu 16 bezahlte Feiertage, 16 Wochen Mutterschafts- und bis zu 4 Wochen Vaterschaftsurlaub als auch hervorragende SozialversicherungsleistungenFlexwork: eigenst√§ndige Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit und -ort, 40-Stundenwoche bei einem 100% Pensum ‚Äì entsprechende Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf, auch dank TeilzeitarbeitMobility als Arbeitgeberin

Durch Wertsch√§tzung und Respekt gepr√§gt ‚Äì das ist Mobility als Arbeitgeberin. Dabei sind unsere Mitarbeitenden unsere Kernkompetenz, welche wir aktiv fordern und f√∂rdern. Wir stellen hohe Anforderungen und unterst√ºtzen individuell mit gezielten Massnahmen, damit die t√§glichen Herausforderungen eigenverantwortlich und engagiert erledigt werden k√∂nnen. Mitunter tr√§gt die einzigartige Unternehmenskultur ihren Teil dazu bei, dass Mitarbeitende mit Freude ihre Arbeit verrichten. Lass dich vom Mobility-Spirit √ºberzeugen und leiste deinen Teil zu einer sinnstiftenden Gesch√§ftsidee. Begeistert und neugierig auf mehr?

Bei Fragen helfe ich gerne weiter.

Title: Trainee - Artificial Intelligence & Data
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices

Are you close to completing a bachelor / master's in science, Information Technology, or a related quantitative discipline, eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and Data? Our AI & Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

About The Position

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.

How You Can Make An Impact


Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making
Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset



Who We Are Looking For


You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
You‚Äôre fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines ‚Äì data management, data platforms, data analytics & (Gen)AI
Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial



Your Team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices.‚ÄØWe specialise in AI & Data ‚Äì empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don‚Äôt hold yourself back ‚Äì apply today.



We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (‚ÄúDTTL‚Äù)

Requisition ID: 17999

Title: Statistician
Description:
Statistician

3 Month contract

Part time

Hybrid - Neuch√¢tel




We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Statistician to lead the development and execution of a Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) for a retrospective study. The role involves extracting relevant data from an established registry and performing predefined analyses according to the SAP. This includes descriptive statistics, survival analysis, comorbidity scoring, and regression modeling.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop a Statistical Analysis Plans (SAP) in alignment with the study protocol.
Extract and prepare data from a pre-existing patient registry for analysis.
Conduct descriptive analyses
Develop and apply multivariable regression models and conduct sub-group analyses as specified in the SAP.
Ensure quality control of extracted data and analytical outputs.
Present and interpret results for internal and external stakeholders, and contribute to scientific publications.




Qualifications:

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related field.
Experience working with retrospective study designs.
Demonstrated ability to write and implement Statistical Analysis Plans.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R, SAS, or Stata.
Strong knowledge of survival analysis, regression modeling, and epidemiological measures (incidence and prevalence).
Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment.




If you are interested please apply or send your CV to luke.sandilands@cpl.com

Title: Research Internship ‚Äì Data Analyst
Description:
The Wyss Zurich Translational Center (Wyss Zurich) is a joint accelerator of the ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich, which was made possible by a generous donation from the Swiss entrepreneur and philanthropist Dr. hc. mult. Hansj√∂rg Wyss. Wyss Zurich brings together some of the world's leading experts to form multidisciplinary teams, pooling their knowledge and expertise and the Recolony project is at the forefront of immune research in cancer.

Your Responsibilities


Conduct literature reviews and analyze quantitative research data.
Curate, wrangle and integrate biological and clinical datasets.
Work with OMICS data from NGS, metabolomics, proteomics to extract meaningful insights.
Implement, test and optimize methods such as Variational Autoencoders (VAE).
Perform advanced neural network and statistical analyses using PyTorch, Python and R.
Generate a scientific report and documentation based on your research findings.
Collaborate with an interdisciplinary research team and participate in ongoing research.


Your profile


Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, Biostatistics, or a related field.
Strong background in biological or clinical data analysis, and quantitative research.
Proficient in Python, with experience in data science (PyTorch) and machine learning.
Comfortable working with OMICS data, including NGS, metabolomics, and proteomics.
Knowledge of command-line tools and Linux-based workflows is plus.
Ability to work independently while seeking guidance when necessary.
Strong scientific communication skills and ability to write structured reports.


Information on your application

Please submit your application as one PDF file, including a motivation letter, your CV including relevant achievements and degrees, and available references.

Title: Intern Data Analyst Customer Satisfaction 80 - 100% (f/m/d)
Description:
Share this job



The Opportunity

Are you passionate about leveraging data to enhance customer satisfaction? We are offering a six-month internship focused on developing innovative solutions for improving customer experience. Join our team and contribute to a project that will enable organizations to systematize and prioritize customer experience improvement initiatives.

How You'll Make An Impact


Conduct data reviews and perform gap analysis to evaluate the structure, quality, and completeness of current datasets
Develop statistical rules and algorithms for prioritizing actions and detecting interdependencies
Establish mechanisms to track the outcomes of customer satisfaction initiatives
Analyze the accuracy and maturity of current datasets and propose methods to test and validate the framework
Lay the foundation for future predictive models
Create a reporting and visualization system for stakeholders


Your Background


Currently enrolled in a Master's program in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling
Good in Python or R for data analysis
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and predictive modeling
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
Ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team



More About Us

Our diverse and inclusive work environment encourages collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring that every team member has the opportunity to grow Join us and be part of a company that is shaping the future of sustainable energy solutions.

Apply now

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data ‚Äì how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

HTML:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact

  • Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
  • Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
  • Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
  • Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
  • Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
  • Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
  • Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
  • Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.




Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:

  • Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
  • Drive to learn new topics and master them
  • Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
  • Consulting and Communication Skills:
  • Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
  • Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
  • Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.


Technical design:

  • Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
  • Technical expertise:
  • First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
  • Familiarity with SQL and Python.


Language Proficiency:

  • Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.


Industry Experience:

  • First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
  • Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.


Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data ‚Äì how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Requisition ID:17116

Title: Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst 40%
Description:
At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together. As the global leader in measurement instrumentation, our ~17.000 employees shape the future in the field of process automation. Whether developing and realizing new technology as a team, collaborating to build instrumentation, or strengthening vital relationships with countless global industries, we work to create trusted relationships that help everyone thrive. As a family-owned company, we look beyond short-term moves and work to create a vision that is forward-thinking for our people, our clients, and the world at large.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We are looking for a Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst with 40% workload to join our Group and and contribute to our cross-functional project team. The position is located in Reinach, BL, Switzerland.

What is the role about?‚ÄØ

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating solutions that drive business decisions? Do you enjoy working collaboratively in a dynamic team environment? Are you eager to take on challenges and make an impact through your work? If so, you are the type of person who would excel in our Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst role. Join us in leveraging data to optimize our demand planning processes, contributing to the success of our integrated business planning initiatives.

Which tasks will you perform?‚ÄØ


You will analyze data as a member if the Integrated Business Planning Data Team, contributing to informed decision making
You will autonomously find solutions to given tasks regarding data analysis, demonstrating resourcefulness and initiative
You will develop diagrams to visually represent complex data sets and analysis results
You will interpret and document data analysis results, providing clear insights for stakeholders


What do we expect from you? ‚ÄØ


Enrolled student
Advanced statistics knowledge
Experience with business warehouse (bw) and business application programming (bap)
Advanced knowledge of Excel, including SAP Analysis for Microsoft Office Plug-in
Collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Knowledge of demand planning and analysis of market-related figures is an advantage


What can you expect from us?‚ÄØ


We are a family-owned, highly committed company with a sustainable vision.
We prioritize Work-Life Balance, offering flexible working hours and remote work opportunities to support our employees in maintaining a healthy balance.
We promote lifelong learning with versatile training and further education opportunities, internal knowledge transfer and e-learning. ‚ÄØ


How do you apply?

To apply we kindly ask you to upload your documents on our career page.

Applications sent to us by E-Mail cannot unfortunately be considered due to Data Privacy considerations.

Agencies, HR service providers, or similar entities are kindly requested to refrain from unsolicited submission of profiles and inquiries regarding potential collaboration. Currently, we do not engage with external service providers for this role. Any unsolicited applications will be disregarded and deleted without further consideration. We appreciate your understanding.

Title: Quantitative Analyst, Power & Gas
Description:
Job Title:

Quantitative Analyst, Power & Gas

Contract Type:

Permanent

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

To support the growth in complex trades being executed by our Power and Gas trading desks, we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to work within our Structuring and Valuation team.

This role is based in London.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop valuation models of complex trades
Work with Trading to validate the appropriateness of model assumptions
Understand model limitations and model risk
Articulate intuition regarding model outputs
Provide insight into trading strategies and asset optimisation
Generate trade ideas and assist with deal structuring
Support Origination and investment decisions
Contribute to the team‚Äôs pricing library with high-quality code
Perform ad-hoc market analyses as required to support decision making
Develop reports and visualisation tools



Key Requirements


3-5 year‚Äôs experience working as a Quantitative Analyst
Degree in a highly quantitative subject, ideally to doctoral level
Understanding of probability, statistics, stochastic calculus, option pricing theory and numerical analysis
Programming experience, ideally in Python
Knowledge of European energy markets
Experience modelling energy assets, including renewables and weather derivatives
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to explain complex mathematical concepts
Desire to work as part of a team as well as being self-driven
Fluent in English



If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Description:
We are working with an established and well renowned commodities trading client who are looking for a Senior Quant Analyst to join their Geneva team.




You'll be joining a desk that specialises in European Power and Gas Trading and work in a company that has a collaborative structure and give people the autonomy to impact company and personal performance.




This role is based in central Geneva and full relocation can be provided for the successful candidate.




Key responsibilities

Developing visualisation tools and reports
Developing the valuation models for complex trades
familiarity with model risk and limitations

Strong foundation in probability, option pricing theory, statistics and numerical analysis
