Title: Director Analyst, Master Data Management (MDM), Remote
Description:
About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data & Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.

What you will do:


Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged ‚Äúmust-have research‚Äù content
Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions


What you will need:


Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.
Demonstrate executive presence; can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills; ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions
Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges
Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
Strong business and financial acumen
Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)


Who you are:


You came from a Data & Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.
You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.


What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?


You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
You are always learning and looking to discover what‚Äôs next in technology.
You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients‚Äô biggest challenges.


Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Job Requisition ID:97651

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

  • Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
  • Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
  • Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
  • Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
  • Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
  • Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
  • Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
  • Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
  • Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
  • Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
  • Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
  • Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions

What you will need:

  • Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
  • Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
  • Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
  • Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.
  • Demonstrate executive presence; can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
  • Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
  • Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills; ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions
  • Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges
  • Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
  • Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
  • Strong business and financial acumen
  • Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
  • Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
  • Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
  • Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
  • Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)

Who you are:

  • You came from a Data & Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
  • You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
  • You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.
  • You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
  • You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
  • You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
  • You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
  • You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.

What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?

  • You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
  • You are always learning and looking to discover what‚Äôs next in technology.
  • You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
  • You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients‚Äô biggest challenges.

Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Job Requisition ID:97651

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Title: Data & AI Consultant | Senior Consultant - Roma
Description:
At PwC, our people in data and analytics focus on leveraging data to drive insights and make informed business decisions. They utilise advanced analytics techniques to help clients optimise their operations and achieve their strategic goals. In business intelligence at PwC, you will focus on leveraging data and analytics to provide strategic insights and drive informed decision-making for clients. You will develop and implement innovative solutions to optimise business performance and enhance competitive advantage.

Focused on relationships, you are building meaningful client connections, and learning how to manage and inspire others. Navigating increasingly complex situations, you are growing your personal brand, deepening technical expertise and awareness of your strengths. You are expected to anticipate the needs of your teams and clients, and to deliver quality. Embracing increased ambiguity, you are comfortable when the path forward isn‚Äôt clear, you ask questions, and you use these moments as opportunities to grow.

Skills

Examples of the skills, knowledge, and experiences you need to lead and deliver value at this level include but are not limited to:


Respond effectively to the diverse perspectives, needs, and feelings of others.
Use a broad range of tools, methodologies and techniques to generate new ideas and solve problems.
Use critical thinking to break down complex concepts.
Understand the broader objectives of your project or role and how your work fits into the overall strategy.
Develop a deeper understanding of the business context and how it is changing.
Use reflection to develop self awareness, enhance strengths and address development areas.
Interpret data to inform insights and recommendations.
Uphold and reinforce professional and technical standards (e.g. refer to specific PwC tax and audit guidance), the Firm's code of conduct, and independence requirements.


Minimum Years Experience Required

Ottima attitudine relazionale, approccio orientato al problem solving, capacit√† di pianificazione e orientamento ai risultati

Formazione continua e accesso a piattaforme di e-learning.

Title: Analista statistico Roma
Description:
Generazione Vincente SpA ‚Äì Agenzia per il Lavoro ‚Äì ricerca per Ente operante nel Settore Agroalimentare:




un/una ESPERTO IN STATISTICA ECONOMICA E GESTIONE BASI DATI.




Posizione

La risorsa, con competenze in scienze statistiche economiche e gestione basi dati, dovr√† supportare i responsabili delle attivit√† previste con particolare riferimento all‚Äôimplementazione della banca dati.

Si occuper√† della ricognizione, dell‚Äôorganizzazione e dell'elaborazione dei dati e delle informazioni disponibili in merito ai terreni agricoli e alle strutture ad essi associate, ai regimi di possesso, alle modalit√† di accesso al credito, all‚Äôandamento del mercato agricolo e, pi√π in generale, a tutti gli aspetti legati alle dinamiche fondiarie.

Supporter√†, inoltre, il referente nella preparazione e validazione del dataset e nell'analisi esplorativa e diagnostica dei dati provenienti da indagini quali/quantitative e in

generale nell‚Äôanalisi ed elaborazione dei dati disponibili relativi alle aziende agricole e alle loro

strategie di difesa attiva e di prevenzione dei rischi.







Requisiti

La risorsa ideale sar√† in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:

‚Ä¢Laurea triennale in scienze statistiche;

‚Ä¢Esperienza di almeno 5 anni in attivit√† di elaborazione dei dati sul settore agricolo, attivit√† di archiviazione e gestione dei dati statistici su DWH, supporto alla realizzazione di indagini quali-quantitative e di tipo panel.

‚Ä¢Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office, buona conoscenza dei SW statistici e di gestione BD (SPSS, Analysis services, MySQL, SQL server, ecc.);

‚Ä¢Completano il profilo capacit√† di analizzare e valutare, concretezza, capacit√† di organizzazione

operativa, capacit√† relazionali e di lavoro in gruppo.







Altre informazioni

Iniziale inserimento a tempo determinato

Full time 36 ore settimanali

un/una ESPERTO IN STATISTICA ECONOMICA E GESTIONE BASI DATI.

La risorsa, con competenze in scienze statistiche economiche e gestione basi dati, dovr√† supportare i responsabili delle attivit√† previste con particolare riferimento all‚Äôimplementazione della banca dati.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST ANALYST - PMO
HTML:
Job Description

Il Gruppo Aeroporti di Roma, nell‚Äôambito della Business Unit Aviation nell‚Äôunit√† Operation & Maintenance, in particolare nell‚Äôasset ‚ÄúO&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations‚Äù √® alla ricerca di:

Data scientist analyst

L‚Äôasset O&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations si occupa principalmente di garantire la progettazione, l‚Äôimplementazione e l‚Äôintegrazione di soluzioni IoT per la gestione degli asset, ingegnerizzando e analizzando i dati al fine di abilitare l‚Äôevoluzione della strategia manutentiva degli asset in ottica di value for money.

La risorsa avr√† maturato un‚Äôesperienza di 3 ‚Äì 5 anni in area automation presso realt√† industriali preferibilmente del settore trasporti/alimentare/beverage/pharma/automotive o presso societ√† impiantistiche costruttrici.

Sar√† considerato un plus l‚Äôaver maturato esperienza nell‚Äôambito di Data Science, Machine Learning o Software Engineering, preferibilmente in strutture di AI e Data analytics all‚Äôinterno di aziende a forte componente industriale/operativa o in aziende di consulenza che hanno sviluppato progetti relativi ai sopracitati ambiti.

Principali attivit√† e aree di responsabilit√†

  • Collaborare alla progettazione e allo sviluppo di nuove funzionalit√† di piattaforme di monitoraggio/SCADA di asset e impianti aeroportuali, automatizzando il processo di gestione dei dati e definendo la tipologia di dati da monitorare;
  • Collaborare attivamente per progettare e concepire nuove sensorizzazioni;
  • Definire, sviluppare e implementare i flussi di dati provenienti dai diversi asset e impianti aeroportuali, assicurando che i dati siano strutturati in modo coerente con le esigenze tecnico/manutentive e pronti per essere analizzati;
  • Integrare nuove fonti di dati nei sistemi esistenti, collaborando con fornitori e strutture tecniche per l‚Äôimplementazione delle soluzioni identificate;
  • Definire e implementare le politiche di data governance, tra cui la definizione di standard di qualit√† dei dati e le linee guida di storicizzazione;
  • Collaborare con i team di data science, data analysis e altri stakeholder aziendali per comprendere le esigenze di dati utili a sviluppare modelli di Machine Learning/AI.

Requisiti Ed Esperienze

  • Conoscenza pratica di PLC, DCS, SCADA, MES e problematiche relative allo scambio di segnali tra differenti sistemi di automazione;
  • Esperienza con protocolli IoT: LoRaWAN, Zigbee, MQTT, OPC-UA per gestione e trasmissione dati sensoriali;
  • Esperienza con protocolli di comunicazione industriale: PROFINET, PROFIBUS, KNX, BACnet, Modbus, Ethernet/IP, CANopen, EtherCAT;
  • Esperienza con sensori e trasduttori per acquisizione dati (temperatura, umidit√†, pressione, accelerometri, giroscopi, vibrazionali, celle di carico, rogowski, sensori RFID/NFC);
  • Conoscenza di calibrazione, condizionamento segnali e interfacciamento con sistemi di acquisizione dati;
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo di board IoT con Raspberry Pi, Arduino, STM32 per applicazioni industriali, monitoraggio remoto, automazione e integrazione sensori;
  • Esperienza in process control, automazione, comunicazione machine-to-machine, machine-to-system e soluzioni Internet of Things (IOT);
  • Comprensione delle strutture dati, della modellazione dei dati e dell'architettura software;
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione C, C++, VB.NET, SQL, Python;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
  • Esperienza con i flussi di lavoro basati sui dati (importazione, pulizia, funzionalit√†);

Competenze

  • Capacit√† di analisi e sintesi;
  • Pianificazione e organizzazione del lavoro;
  • Problem Solving;
  • Teamwork;
  • Orientamento al risultato.

Titolo Di Studi

  • Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria dell‚Äôautomazione, Ingegneria informatica, Ingegneria elettronica, Ingegneria elettrica.
  • Sar√† considerato titolo preferenziale l‚Äôaver partecipato ad un master/corso di formazione in AI, Machine Learning, con particolare focus sull'integrazione delle tecnologie IoT nei processi di automazione e nella gestione dei sistemi industriali intelligenti, inclusi i sistemi di monitoraggio e controllo avanzato.

Sede Di Lavoro

Fiumicino Aeroporto

Tipologia Di Offerta

  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato;
  • Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida.

La selezione √® rivolta ad entrambi i sessi nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006.

Offerta di lavoro tutelata dalla L. 68/99 ‚Äì Categorie protette.

Title: (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) ‚Äì Coordination Division (COORD) ‚Äì at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications


Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate‚Äôs intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank‚Äôs data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities


Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG‚Äôs data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate; and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate


Qualifications


University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ‚Äôs mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST ANALYST - PMO
HTML:
Job Description

Il Gruppo Aeroporti di Roma, nell‚Äôambito della Business Unit Aviation nell‚Äôunit√† Operation & Maintenance, in particolare nell‚Äôasset ‚ÄúO&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations‚Äù √® alla ricerca di:

Data scientist analyst

L‚Äôasset O&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations si occupa principalmente di garantire la progettazione, l‚Äôimplementazione e l‚Äôintegrazione di soluzioni IoT per la gestione degli asset, ingegnerizzando e analizzando i dati al fine di abilitare l‚Äôevoluzione della strategia manutentiva degli asset in ottica di value for money.

La risorsa avr√† maturato un‚Äôesperienza di 3 ‚Äì 5 anni in area automation presso realt√† industriali preferibilmente del settore trasporti/alimentare/beverage/pharma/automotive o presso societ√† impiantistiche costruttrici.

Sar√† considerato un plus l‚Äôaver maturato esperienza nell‚Äôambito di Data Science, Machine Learning o Software Engineering, preferibilmente in strutture di AI e Data analytics all‚Äôinterno di aziende a forte componente industriale/operativa o in aziende di consulenza che hanno sviluppato progetti relativi ai sopracitati ambiti.

Principali attivit√† e aree di responsabilit√†

  • Collaborare alla progettazione e allo sviluppo di nuove funzionalit√† di piattaforme di monitoraggio/SCADA di asset e impianti aeroportuali, automatizzando il processo di gestione dei dati e definendo la tipologia di dati da monitorare;
  • Collaborare attivamente per progettare e concepire nuove sensorizzazioni;
  • Definire, sviluppare e implementare i flussi di dati provenienti dai diversi asset e impianti aeroportuali, assicurando che i dati siano strutturati in modo coerente con le esigenze tecnico/manutentive e pronti per essere analizzati;
  • Integrare nuove fonti di dati nei sistemi esistenti, collaborando con fornitori e strutture tecniche per l‚Äôimplementazione delle soluzioni identificate;
  • Definire e implementare le politiche di data governance, tra cui la definizione di standard di qualit√† dei dati e le linee guida di storicizzazione;
  • Collaborare con i team di data science, data analysis e altri stakeholder aziendali per comprendere le esigenze di dati utili a sviluppare modelli di Machine Learning/AI.

Requisiti Ed Esperienze

  • Conoscenza pratica di PLC, DCS, SCADA, MES e problematiche relative allo scambio di segnali tra differenti sistemi di automazione;
  • Esperienza con protocolli IoT: LoRaWAN, Zigbee, MQTT, OPC-UA per gestione e trasmissione dati sensoriali;
  • Esperienza con protocolli di comunicazione industriale: PROFINET, PROFIBUS, KNX, BACnet, Modbus, Ethernet/IP, CANopen, EtherCAT;
  • Esperienza con sensori e trasduttori per acquisizione dati (temperatura, umidit√†, pressione, accelerometri, giroscopi, vibrazionali, celle di carico, rogowski, sensori RFID/NFC);
  • Conoscenza di calibrazione, condizionamento segnali e interfacciamento con sistemi di acquisizione dati;
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo di board IoT con Raspberry Pi, Arduino, STM32 per applicazioni industriali, monitoraggio remoto, automazione e integrazione sensori;
  • Esperienza in process control, automazione, comunicazione machine-to-machine, machine-to-system e soluzioni Internet of Things (IOT);
  • Comprensione delle strutture dati, della modellazione dei dati e dell'architettura software;
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione C, C++, VB.NET, SQL, Python;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
  • Esperienza con i flussi di lavoro basati sui dati (importazione, pulizia, funzionalit√†);

Competenze

  • Capacit√† di analisi e sintesi;
  • Pianificazione e organizzazione del lavoro;
  • Problem Solving;
  • Teamwork;
  • Orientamento al risultato.

Titolo Di Studi

  • Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria dell‚Äôautomazione, Ingegneria informatica, Ingegneria elettronica, Ingegneria elettrica.
  • Sar√† considerato titolo preferenziale l‚Äôaver partecipato ad un master/corso di formazione in AI, Machine Learning, con particolare focus sull'integrazione delle tecnologie IoT nei processi di automazione e nella gestione dei sistemi industriali intelligenti, inclusi i sistemi di monitoraggio e controllo avanzato.

Sede Di Lavoro

Fiumicino Aeroporto

Tipologia Di Offerta

  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato;
  • Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida.

La selezione √® rivolta ad entrambi i sessi nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006.

Offerta di lavoro tutelata dalla L. 68/99 ‚Äì Categorie protette.

Title: Operations Trainee
HTML:
Greening Group √® una societ√† internazionale specializzata nella progettazione, sviluppo, costruzione e manutenzione di impianti energetici fotovoltaici. Lavoriamo per costruire un mondo pi√π sostenibile e portiamo soluzioni di energia rinnovabile e di efficienza energetica in tutto il mondo.


Per Greening Energy, societ√† specializzata nel trading energetico, siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire nel ruolo di Operations Trainee. La sua missione principale sar√† supportare lo sviluppo di un software aziendale per l‚Äôanalisi dei dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di rendere pi√π efficiente il lavoro del dipartimento.


Responsabilit√†:

  • Imparare il funzionamento dei mercati energetici (gas, elettrico, ambientale) e acquisire conoscenza sugli analisi dei prezzi;
  • Imparare l‚Äôimportanza dei dati di costo/ricavo e gli aggiustamenti ad asta;
  • Approfondire le dinamiche operative dei mercati elettrici (previsioni dei consumi, produzione rinnovabile, invio nomine ai mercati e reportistica operativa) e le diverse modalit√† di acquisto de energia elettrica;
  • Elaborazione di strumenti di previsione e analisi che permettano un analisi dei dati efficace ed efficiente;

Requisiti:

  • Laureando/laureato in ingegneria informatica o in percorsi di studio con specializzazione in modelli matematici/statistici;
  • Ottime capacit√† di analisi ed elaborazione di dati;

  • Ottime capacit√† di organizzazione;
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Cosa Offriamo:

Title: DATA Scientist
HTML:
Il Gruppo BCC Iccrea √® il maggiore gruppo bancario cooperativo, l‚Äôunico gruppo bancario nazionale a capitale interamente italiano e il quarto gruppo bancario in Italia per attivi. Oggi il Gruppo √® costituito da 114 Banche di Credito Cooperativo, presenti in oltre 1.700 comuni italiani con quasi 2.500 sportelli, e da altre societ√† bancarie, finanziarie e strumentali controllate da BCC Banca Iccrea.


La Capogruppo BCC Banca Iccrea cerca una risorsa da inserire nel ruolo di Data Scientist per l‚ÄôUnit√† Organizzativa HR Operations all‚Äôinterno dell‚ÄôArea Chief Operating Officer per gestire il piano di Intelligenza Artificiale, guidare la prioritizzazione degli use case e definire le scelte metodologiche per lo sviluppo dei modelli, con l‚Äôintento di massimizzare la riusabilit√†, la flessibilit√† e la scalabilit√† delle soluzioni.

La persona verr√† inserita nella sede di Roma.


In particolare, la persona si occuper√† di:


  • Lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia, collaborando con team multidisciplinari per sviluppare soluzioni AI scalabili e trasformative;
  • sviluppare, implementare e ottimizzare modelli di machine learning e intelligenza artificiale per risolvere problemi aziendali complessi;
  • analizzare grandi dataset per estrarre informazioni utili, identificare pattern, tendenze e correlazioni;
  • collaborare con sviluppatori, data scientist e stakeholder interni per integrare soluzioni AI nei processi aziendali esistenti;
  • monitorare le prestazioni dei modelli AI e implementare miglioramenti per garantirne l'efficacia e l'affidabilit√†;
  • ricercare e testare nuove tecnologie AI per mantenere l'azienda al passo con le innovazioni del settore.


Requisiti:


  • Laurea in disciplina ingegneristica/informatica, Statistica, Matematica/fisica;
  • 3-5 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti complessi in ambito AI, machine learning e data analysis;
  • ottima conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, e utilizzo dei principali framework di machine learning e deep learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn);
  • competenza nell‚Äôuso di strumenti di Business Intelligence (BI) e piattaforme di cloud computing (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud);
  • esperienza con tecnologie big data (ad esempio Hadoop, Spark);
  • requisito preferenziale esperienza in progettazione e sviluppo di modelli AI;
  • buona padronanza delle metodologie di lavoro agile (Scrum, Kanban);
  • competenze avanzate in Excel e PowerPoint per l'analisi e la presentazione dei risultati;
  • capacit√† di applicare tecniche per il tuning e il miglioramento continuo dei modelli AI;
  • ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese ;
  • capacit√† di analisi e sintesi, problem solving, orientamento al cliente, lavoro in gruppo.


In caso di interesse, leggi attentamente l'informativa sulla privacy riportata nell'area Privacy del sito web di BCC Banca Iccrea e invia la tua candidatura allegando il cv. Ti ricordiamo che, ai sensi dell‚Äôart. 111-bis del Codice Privacy, non √® necessaria l‚Äôautorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali presenti nel tuo cv.


La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed √® aperta a candidature di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il Gruppo BCC Iccrea riconosce che l'attenzione delle diversit√†, l‚Äôinclusione e la tutela dell‚Äôequilibrio fra vita privata e vita professionale siano principi fondamentali di creazione di valore per il Gruppo stesso.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Siamo una Data Driven Transformation & Consulting Company specializzata nel gestire e trasformare il pi√π importante asset del mercato odierno: I Dati.

Grazie ad oltre 20 anni di esperienza e 500 dipendenti divisi in 4 sedi (Bologna HQ, Milano, Roma e Napoli) supportiamo l‚Äôevoluzione di grandi gruppi italiani operanti in tutti i principali settori, dal bancario al manifatturiero, passando per il Fashion, il Retail, l‚ÄôEnergy e le Telco senza dimenticare le grandi pubbliche amministrazioni centrali.

Il nostro portfolio progetti spazia da servizi di Advisory quali la realizzazione di Data Strategy fino ad attivit√† di implementazione con il design e la realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Analytics, Big Data Platform & Artificial Intelligence.

Siamo un‚Äôazienda dinamica, con un Dna che si √® plasmato in questi anni grazie al fatto di aver coltivato oltre l‚Äô80% delle nostre risorse dall‚Äôuniversit√†, e in continua trasformazione cos√¨ come il mercato in cui operiamo e del quale siamo fra i player pi√π riconosciuti e grandi del panorama italiano.

Posizione:

Iconsulting √® alla ricerca di talentuosi neolaureati da inserire nei team di progetto con il ruolo di Data Engineer.

Entrando a far parte della nostra squadra, avrai l'opportunit√† di lavorare a stretto contatto con un team di esperti su progetti innovativi e tecnicamente avanzati nell'ambito dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di aiutare i clienti a sviluppare le loro strategie IT.

Al tuo ingresso in Azienda riceverai una formazione strutturata e sarai supportato da un tutor dedicato che ti guider√† nell'apprendimento delle principali tecnologie di mercato e ti aiuter√† a sviluppare le competenze necessarie.

Requisiti:


Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica o Informatica
Esperienza pratica con database relazionali e competenza nell'utilizzo di SQL
Una buona conoscenza dei linguaggi Python e Java
Conoscenza preferenziale in ambito Data integration e Database (Relazionali es. MySql);
Interesse per le tecnologie NoSQL e Big Data
Preferibile familiarit√† con strumenti di Data Visualization come Tableau, Power BI o Qlik
Padronanza del pacchetto Office.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Un'attitudine all'analisi logico-matematica
Curiosit√†, voglia di imparare, proattivit√† e interesse per i principali trend tecnologici del momento


Altre informazioni:

Cosa offriamo ai candidati?

Ai candidati selezionati verr√† offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

Siamo una Data Driven Transformation & Consulting Company specializzata nel gestire e trasformare il pi√π importante asset del mercato odierno: I Dati.

Grazie ad oltre 20 anni di esperienza e 500 dipendenti divisi in 4 sedi (Bologna HQ, Milano, Roma e Napoli) supportiamo l‚Äôevoluzione di grandi gruppi italiani operanti in tutti i principali settori, dal bancario al manifatturiero, passando per il Fashion, il Retail, l‚ÄôEnergy e le Telco senza dimenticare le grandi pubbliche amministrazioni centrali.

Il nostro portfolio progetti spazia da servizi di Advisory quali la realizzazione di Data Strategy fino ad attivit√† di implementazione con il design e la realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Analytics, Big Data Platform & Artificial Intelligence.

Siamo un‚Äôazienda dinamica, con un Dna che si √® plasmato in questi anni grazie al fatto di aver coltivato oltre l‚Äô80% delle nostre risorse dall‚Äôuniversit√†, e in continua trasformazione cos√¨ come il mercato in cui operiamo e del quale siamo fra i player pi√π riconosciuti e grandi del panorama italiano.

Posizione:

Iconsulting √® alla ricerca di talentuosi neolaureati da inserire nei team di progetto con il ruolo di Data Engineer.

Entrando a far parte della nostra squadra, avrai l'opportunit√† di lavorare a stretto contatto con un team di esperti su progetti innovativi e tecnicamente avanzati nell'ambito dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di aiutare i clienti a sviluppare le loro strategie IT.

Al tuo ingresso in Azienda riceverai una formazione strutturata e sarai supportato da un tutor dedicato che ti guider√† nell'apprendimento delle principali tecnologie di mercato e ti aiuter√† a sviluppare le competenze necessarie.

Requisiti:

  • Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica o Informatica
  • Esperienza pratica con database relazionali e competenza nell'utilizzo di SQL
  • Una buona conoscenza dei linguaggi Python e Java
  • Conoscenza preferenziale in ambito Data integration e Database (Relazionali es. MySql);
  • Interesse per le tecnologie NoSQL e Big Data
  • Preferibile familiarit√† con strumenti di Data Visualization come Tableau, Power BI o Qlik
  • Padronanza del pacchetto Office.
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Un'attitudine all'analisi logico-matematica
  • Curiosit√†, voglia di imparare, proattivit√† e interesse per i principali trend tecnologici del momento

Altre informazioni:

Cosa offriamo ai candidati?

Ai candidati selezionati verr√† offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

Sede di lavoro: Roma o Napoli. E' previsto lo smart working.

Title: Junior ‚Äì AI & RPA Developer Data analytics
Description:
Junior - AI & RPA Developer Data analytics

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team Smart Solutions Lab di Deloitte Business Solution nella sedi di Milano e Roma che lavorer√† in modalit√† Hybrid.

Smart Solutions Lab si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttivit√†, efficienza, qualit√† dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie di AI, Robotics Process Automation e Data Visualization. All‚Äôinterno del team ci si impegna a definire l'avanguardia delle soluzioni aziendali attraverso l'uso innovativo di concetti di intelligenza artificiale, Robotics Process Automation (RPA) e Optical Character Recognition (OCR). Oltre all'automazione dei processi, una parte delle attivit√† produttive si concentra sulla creazione di dashboard avanzate in ambito analytics tramite l‚Äôutilizzo di strumenti come PowerBI o Qlik Sense. La Data Visualization √® cruciale per rendere i dati comprensibili, utili e facilmente fruibili da parte dei clienti.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sar√† inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:


Raccogliere, sintetizzare e analizzare dati complessi utilizzando strumenti e tecnologie appropriati;
Utilizzare efficientemente le principali tecnologie nell'analisi e progettazione dei processi aziendali end-to-end, dall'identificazione delle inefficienze (utilizzando tecniche quantitative e qualitative) alla progettazione e all'implementazione dei processi aziendali TO-BE;


Winning Requirements


Laurea in materie tecnico/scientifiche: Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Statistica
Disponibilit√† a viaggiare in Italia e all'estero
Confidenza con strumenti di Data Visualization (PowerBI, Qlik Sense, QlikView o Tableau)
Conoscenza base di strumenti di automazione robotica quali UiPath e BluePrism
Conoscenza del linguaggio SQL e utilizzo di SQL Server
Conoscenza di linguaggi per lo sviluppo web (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, ASP.NET, node.js)
Esperienza nello sviluppo di APP su ambiente iOS e/o Android


To Make An Impact That Matters

Il network Deloitte, leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, opera a livello globale in pi√π di 150 Paesi con oltre 460 mila persone.

In qualit√† di network globale ci impegniamo per affrontare le principali sfide sociali, economiche e ambientali della societ√† di oggi. WorldImpact √® il nostro programma globale che riunisce tutte le iniziative attraverso cui vogliamo avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, i clienti, l‚Äôambiente e le comunit√† in cui operiamo.

Con Impact for Italy, la declinazione italiana di WorldImpact, Deloitte ha realizzato progetti che ‚Äì in collaborazione con istituzioni, realt√† del terzo settore, universit√† e altri soggetti ‚Äì hanno lasciato un impatto concreto e una legacy per il futuro su tutto il territorio nazionale.

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Title: Operations Trainee
HTML:
Greening Group √® una societ√† internazionale specializzata nella progettazione, sviluppo, costruzione e manutenzione di impianti energetici fotovoltaici. Lavoriamo per costruire un mondo pi√π sostenibile e portiamo soluzioni di energia rinnovabile e di efficienza energetica in tutto il mondo.


Per Greening Energy, societ√† specializzata nel trading energetico, siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire nel ruolo di Operations Trainee. La sua missione principale sar√† supportare lo sviluppo di un software aziendale per l‚Äôanalisi dei dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di rendere pi√π efficiente il lavoro del dipartimento.


Responsabilit√†:

  • Imparare il funzionamento dei mercati energetici (gas, elettrico, ambientale) e acquisire conoscenza sugli analisi dei prezzi;
  • Imparare l‚Äôimportanza dei dati di costo/ricavo e gli aggiustamenti ad asta;
  • Approfondire le dinamiche operative dei mercati elettrici (previsioni dei consumi, produzione rinnovabile, invio nomine ai mercati e reportistica operativa) e le diverse modalit√† di acquisto de energia elettrica;
  • Elaborazione di strumenti di previsione e analisi che permettano un analisi dei dati efficace ed efficiente;
  • Supporto nella gestione e controllo della qualit√† dei dati, con preparazione di report e comunicazioni sui risultati per supportare le decisioni.


Requisiti:

  • Laureando/laureato in ingegneria informatica o in percorsi di studio con specializzazione in modelli matematici/statistici;
  • Ottime capacit√† di analisi ed elaborazione di dati;
  • Ottima conoscenza di linguaggi informatici come PHP, Python e MYSQL;
  • Ottime capacit√† di organizzazione;
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Cosa Offriamo:

  • Tirocinio curriculare o extracurriculare della durata di sei mesi con possibilit√† di assunzione alla finalizzazione;
  • Concrete possibilit√† di carriera in contesto dinamico multiculturale e con elevate prospettive di ulteriore sviluppo;
  • Coaching per lo sviluppo professionale sul campo del mercato delle rinnovabili;
  • Contesto di lavoro aperto e collaborativo.


L‚Äôannuncio si rivolge a candidati di entrambi i sessi (L.903/77). L'interessato/a pu√≤ inviare la propria candidatura rilasciando lo specifico consenso al trattamento dei dati personali, ai sensi della L. 196/03.

Title: AI Specialist
Description:
AI Specialist




L'AI Specialist contribuir√† alla progettazione, allo sviluppo e all'implementazione di soluzioni basate sull'Intelligenza Artificiale.




Il/la candidato/a si occuper√† principalmente delle seguenti attivit√†:




Progettare, sviluppare e implementare modelli di Machine Learning e Deep Learning per risolvere problematiche aziendali specifiche.
Analizzare e pre-elaborare grandi volumi di dati strutturati e non strutturati.
Ottimizzare le prestazioni dei modelli tramite tecniche avanzate di tuning e validazione.
Collaborare con il team IT per integrare soluzioni AI nei sistemi esistenti e garantire la scalabilit√† delle applicazioni.
Realizzare prototipi per la sperimentazione di nuove tecnologie AI e per la validazione di use case.
Monitorare e mantenere i modelli AI/ML in produzione per garantirne l'affidabilit√† e le performance nel tempo.
Identificare e implementare algoritmi innovativi per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali.
Curare la documentazione tecnica relativa ai progetti AI e fornire supporto tecnico e formazione ai colleghi meno esperti nell'adozione di tecnologie AI.




SKILLS RICHIESTE:




Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Statistica o discipline affini.
Costituisce titolo preferenziale il possesso di un Dottorato in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science o Intelligenza Artificiale.
Esperienza di 4/5 anni nello sviluppo e implementazione di soluzioni di Intelligenza Artificiale.
Solida esperienza nella Generative AI, inclusa la progettazione, implementazione e ottimizzazione di modelli generativi.
Conoscenza avanzata dei linguaggi di programmazione.
Esperienza con framework e librerie di Machine Learning e Deep Learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras, ecc.).
Competenze avanzate in gestione dei dati: utilizzo di database SQL/NoSQL e strumenti per big data (Hadoop, Spark).
Conoscenza di tecniche di Natural Language Processing (NLP) e Computer Vision.
Esperienza con piattaforme cloud e strumenti di MLOps per la gestione del ciclo di vita dei modelli AI.




Il nostro Cliente √® una prestigiosa realt√† nell'ambito Technology

Location: Roma, in modalit√† ibrida




Intermedia Selection, societ√† leader in Italia nella ricerca e selezione di professional e middle management, √® presente in Italia con pi√π di 35 consulenti tra gli uffici di Milano e Roma.

Autorizzazione del ministero del lavoro n¬∞ 20323/RS

Title: Data Modeler
HTML:
Siamo un‚ÄôAzienda italiana attiva in ambito Data & Artificial Intelligence.

Il Gruppo dispone di tecnologie proprietarie, soluzioni e servizi che concretizzano il potenziale dell‚ÄôAI e dei dati nell‚Äôevoluzione digitale di Aziende e Pubbliche Amministrazioni e pu√≤ contare su oltre 300 clienti nazionali ed internazionali, in settori quali Government, Finance, Energy & Utilities, Turismo, Healthcare, operando direttamente e tramite partner.

Oltre 400 professionisti e laboratori tecnologici AI dedicati allo sviluppo di prodotti, piattaforme e soluzioni verticali destinate ai diversi comparti di mercato.

Posizione:

Entrerai a far parte della struttura Open Data & Semantic Web Services all‚Äôinterno della Direzione Knowledge & Operations.

Che ruolo ricoprirai?

Nel ruolo di Data Modeler avrai la responsabilit√† di progettare, implementare, gestire e manutenere gli asset semantici prodotti all‚Äôinterno dei progetti della practice.

Responsabilit√† ed attivit√†:

  • Raccolta dei requisiti con il cliente e interazione con gli esperti di dominio;
  • Creazione ontologie di dominio utilizzando gli standard del W3C;
  • Progettazione ed esecuzione di task di Data preparation, Data cleansing, Data Reconciliation e verifiche di Data Quality;
  • Predisposizione mapping e strumenti di produzione dati RDF con tecnologie standard;
  • Descrizione e metadatazione di dati e servizi secondo gli standard del web semantico;
  • Redazione documentazione tecnica.


Requisiti:

  • Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica o cultura equivalente;
  • Conoscenza dei principali protocolli e architetture del web e del web semantico;
  • Conoscenza degli standard RDF e RDFS;
  • Linguaggio SPARQL;
  • Modellazione concettuale, logica e fisica di DB relazionali;
  • Esperienze con DB NoSQL preferibilmente con DB a grafo;
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi SQL.


Competenze gradite:

  • Esperienze di utilizzo di repository RDF (Virtuoso, GraphDB, Blazegraph);
  • Standard del web semantico: OWL, SKOS, RDF, RDFS, SHACL;
  • Linguaggi di mapping del W3C: RML, R2RML;
  • Esperienze di utilizzo di motori di ricerca (SOLR, Elasticsearch);
  • Linguaggi di programmazione: Python, Java, JavaScript.


Altre informazioni:

La tua opportunit√† √® ora! Se l‚Äôinnovazione √® la tua passione, se esplorare il mondo dell‚ÄôInformation e Communication Technologies √® un tuo desiderio, se la tua aspirazione √® lavorare in un Team con forte volont√† di condivisione e focalizzato su obiettivi sempre pi√π sfidanti, incontriamoci ora!

Tenendo fede ai nostri impegni, prestiamo attenzione alle risorse appartenenti alle categorie protette, ai sensi degli articoli 1 e 18 della legge 68 del ‚Äô99.

I dati personali saranno trattati in conformit√† alle disposizioni contenute nel regolamento UE 2016/679.

CED Digital & Servizi √® la societ√† del Gruppo Caltagirone Editore che si occupa di: progettazione, innovazione, sviluppo e gestione digital delle testate del gruppo, gestione infrastrutturale dei sistemi IT e consulenza digital per clienti e partner commerciali.

Preprocessing e Analisi Dati
Sviluppo di modelli di Machine Learning e Deep Learning
Applicazione di AI Generativa

Conosci i linguaggi R e Python

Hai una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese

Title: Junior Data Analytics Engineer
HTML:
Immobiliare.it S.p.A. is an Italian group composed of companies specializing in Digital Tech services for the sale and rental of real estate, aimed at individuals, real estate professionals, banking institutions and financial sector operators.


Founded in 2005, Immobiliare.it, the No. 1 real estate portal in Italy, has expanded its offering with specialized portals such as Trovacasa.it, MioAffitto and LuxuryEstate.com, dedicated to luxury properties.


Immobiliare.it Insights, the company's proptech division, offers digital advisory, insights and data diligence services to banks, investors and appraisers. A leading player in Italy in the mortgage sector, the group includes Immobiliare.it Mutui, specializing in remote credit brokerage, Euroansa with a network of over 800 credit brokers throughout the country and Genio Diligence, a company focused on credit risk and fraud prevention for brokers and financial institutions. The group is also present in foreign markets in Spain (Pisos.com, Indomio.es and Enalquiler.com), Greece (Spitogatos.gr, Indomio.gr), Slovenia (Nekretnine.net) and Croatia (Crozilla.com and Indomio.hr).


We are looking for a Junior Data Analytics Engineer to join our Marketing team.


What you will learn:

  • marketing analytics: measurement of marketing campaigns with a focus on causality, optimization and data-driven decision-making;
  • data management and architecture: data warehousing and big data analytics using cloud technologies (GCP, AWS) and open-source tools (Airflow, dataform, dbt);
  • data pipelines: design and manage reliable marketing data pipelines to provide new insights and detect threats and opportunities;
  • data products: build end-to-end marketing data products combining internal data with several external sources like market and industry trends (e.g. market data, Google searches, online research) and competitive intelligence tools (e.g. Similarweb, data.ai, Semrush).


Who you are:

  • new graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Physics;
  • analytical mindset with a problem solving approach;
  • curious and passionate about marketing and tech platforms;
  • fluent in English and working knowledge of Italian.


Nice-to-have skills:

  • experience with Python and SQL;
  • familiarity with Google Cloud Platform.


About our team:

Our team is responsible for all marketing activities of our Group: Immobiliare.it (Italy), Indomio.es (Spain), Immotop.lu (Luxembourg), Crozilla.com (Croatia) and LuxuryEstate (Global)


We focus mainly on:

  • performance marketing: we design, create and manage campaigns with different business objectives (e.g. user acquisition and engagement, lead generation and brand awareness). We are one of the top advertisers in our markets, we collaborate with the best partners and our strong relationship with them allow us to develop ad-hoc projects and to access new features, products and technologies before they‚Äôre widely released;
  • analytics: Our products generate hundreds of millions of events every day, by analysing these interactions we can learn about our customers and their experience, optimise marketing investments, uncover new opportunities, and support data-driven decision-making.
  • market and competitor insights: we study the real estate market and our industry to uncover emerging trends, discover business opportunities and forecast demand as accurately as possible to stay ahead of the curve;
  • projects: we drive growth, operational and technological improvements working cross-team and cross-competence (Tech, Product, Sales, PR & Content teams).


What we offer:

  • a young and dynamic work environment;
  • an opportunity in a fast-growing company;
  • paid internship contract or fixed contract;
  • ticket restaurants;
  • free coffee and fresh fruit every day;
  • break room with a foosball table;
  • office located in the centre of Rome (Termini).


This announcement is addressed to people of any sex, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

Title: Opportunit√† per neolaureati STEM in ambito Digital, Technology & Operations
Description:
Costruisci il futuro digitale del Paese con noi!




Poste Italiane √® alla ricerca di giovani talenti con una formazione STEM che vogliano contribuire alla trasformazione digitale di una realt√† unica in Italia.

Con circa 120.000 dipendenti, 45 milioni di clienti e servizi che spaziano dalla logistica ai pagamenti digitali, dall‚Äôambito finanziario a quello assicurativo, dalla telefonia mobile al settore energetico, Poste √® oggi protagonista dell‚Äôinnovazione tecnologica e sociale del Paese.




Cosa fa il team Digital, Technology & Operations

Il team DTO √® il motore dell‚Äôinnovazione in Poste Italiane.

Si occupa di modernizzare l‚Äôarchitettura IT, sviluppare soluzioni digitali e ottimizzare i processi aziendali attraverso tecnologie avanzate come cloud, intelligenza artificiale, data analytics, automazione, UX design, ecc.. Far parte del team DTO significa lavorare su progetti concreti, innovativi e a impatto nazionale.




Chi stiamo cercando

Neolaureati in ambito STEM: Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica o discipline affini, con voglia di crescere e mettersi in gioco.




Requisiti

Laurea ‚Äì triennale e magistrale - in discipline scientifiche o tecnologiche
Buona conoscenza del pacchetto Office e degli strumenti digitali
Capacit√† analitiche e approccio concreto al problem solving
Attitudine alla collaborazione digitale e al lavoro in team
Ottime capacit√† comunicative
Coraggio, creativit√† e spirito di iniziativa
Curiosit√†, apertura mentale e voglia di innovare ogni giorno




Cosa offriamo

Contratto a tempo indeterminato sin dal primo giorno
Un programma di onboarding e di formazione continua
Percorsi di sviluppo professionale
Team appassionati e dinamici, pronti ad accoglierti
L‚Äôopportunit√† di contribuire alla trasformazione digitale del Paese
Un ambiente che valorizza merito, diversit√† e innovazione




Un processo di selezione diverso dal solito

Abbiamo creato un percorso innovativo per selezionare il tuo talento:

Test tecnici, challenge online e interviste digitali
Approcci non convenzionali per valorizzare la tua personalit√† e le tue potenzialit√†
Un‚Äôesperienza di selezione progettata per stimolare la creativit√† e il pensiero critico




Pronto a metterti in gioco?

Trasforma la tua passione in opportunit√†.

Entra a far parte del cambiamento, entra in Poste Italiane.




Find out more information on www.posteitaliane.it

Title: Director Analyst, Master Data Management (MDM), Remote
Description:
About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data & Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.

What you will do:


Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged ‚Äúmust-have research‚Äù content
Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions


What you will need:


Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.
Demonstrate executive presence; can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills; ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions
Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges
Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
Strong business and financial acumen
Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)


Who you are:


You came from a Data & Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.
You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.


What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?


You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
You are always learning and looking to discover what‚Äôs next in technology.
You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients‚Äô biggest challenges.


Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Job Requisition ID:97651

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
